loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Badeya, sont mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Konifla, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiments  du beurre de karité du lait du savon des beignets, de céréales et font de la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Badeya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Mariam  la troisième personne  à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter des sacs de tubercules avec son argent à Dioila, qui seront vendus à Wacoro et environnants. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5000FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women of the Badeya group are married and, on average, are 40 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Konifla, Wacoro commune, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. 

They engage in the sales of of condiments, shea butter, milk, soap, beignets, and cereals and work in food preparation. The women of the Badeya group are on their first group loan. 

Mariam, the third person standing from the right, plans to buy bags of tubers in Dioila with her loan, which will be sold in Wacoro and the surrounding areas.

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 5,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to support her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy tubers

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, sont mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Konifla, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiment  du beurre de karité du lait du savon des beignets, de céréales et de la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Bintou  deuxième personne  à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter deux cartons de savon avec son argent à Dioila, qui seront vendus à Wacoro et environnants. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 6.000 FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales
texts.en:
The women of the Kotognontala group are married and, on average, are 34 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Konifia, Wacoro commune, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They engage in the sales of condiments, shea butter, milk, soap, beignets, cereals, and work in food preparation. The Kotognontala group are on their first group loan.

Bintou, the person standing second from the left, plans to buy two cartons of soap in Dioila with her loan, which will be sold in Wacoro and in the surrounding areas. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 6,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in the business and used to support her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Nièta, sont mariées, ont en moyenne 50 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Konifla, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiment  du beurre de karité du lait du savon des beignets et de céréales.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Nieta sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises citées ci-dessus.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Hawa Yacouba  la deuxième personne assise à partir de la droite, compte acheter  diverses sortes de condiments, qui seront vendus  en détail au comptant et à crédit dans les villages et sur place. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 8.000 FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of the Nièta group are married and, on average, are 50 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Konifia, Wacoro commune, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They engage in the sales of condiments, shea butter, milk, soap, beignets, and cereals. The Nièta group are on their first group loan, which will be used to buy the different goods mentioned above.

Hawa Yacouba, the person seated second from the right, plans to buy different types of condiments, which will be sold at retail for cash and credit in the villages and in town. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 8,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in the business and used to support her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Sabou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabou, sont mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Konifla, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiment  du beurre de karité du lait du savon des beignets, de céréales et de la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Sabou sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Oumou   la première personne assise à partir de la droite, compte acheter 10 pièces de tissus wax à Bamako, qui seront vendus à Wacoro. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25000 FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabou group are married and, on average, are 33 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Konifla, Wacoro commune, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They engage in the sales of shea butter, milk, soap, beignets, cereals, and work in food preparation. The Sabou group are on their first group loan.

Oumou, the first person seated on the right, plans to buy ten lengths of wax pagne from Bamako, which will be sold in Wacoro. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 25,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in the business and used to support her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy pagnes

loans.name: Siguitemasson Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Siguitemasson, sont  mariées, ont en moyenne30 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Konifla, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiment  du beurre de karité du lait du savon, de céréales et de la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Siguitemasson sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Mafou  la quatrième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter des tubercules à Dioila, qui seront vendus dans la ville de Fana, dans le village de Wacoro, et de Nangola. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000 FCFA qui sera  utilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women in the Siguitemasson group are married, and on average they are 30 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Konifla, town de Wacoro, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali).

They know one another through family, neighbors, and friendship. They sell condiments, shea butter, milk, soap, cereals, and restaurant supplies. 

This is the first group loan for the women of the Siguitemasson group.                                                                                                                                                                                    

The client, Mafou, is standing fourth from the right. She would like to buy tubers in Dioila that she will sell in the city of Fana, and in the villages of Wacoro and Nangola. She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA that will be used for the business and for her household expenses.

loans.use: buy tubers.

loans.name: Yelen Group

Les femmes du groupe Yelen sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises citées ci-dessus.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Oumou la troisième personne  à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter des sacs de tubercules avec son argent à Beleco, qui seront vendus à Wacoro et environnants. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5000FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales
texts.en:
The women in the Yelen group are married. On average, they are 30 years old and have four children. They all live in extended families in the village of Konifla, town of Wacoro, prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali).

They know one another through relatives, neighbors, and friendship. They sell condiments, Shea butter, soap, and cereals. 

This is the first group loan for the women of the Yelen group. The loan will be used to buy the various goods listed above. 

The client, Oumou, is standing third from the right. With her money, she would like to buy sacks of tubers in Beleco. She will sell these in Wacoro and neighboring areas. 

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 5,000 FCFA, which she'll reuse for her business and for household expenses.

loans.use: buy tubers.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, sont mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, commune de Guégnaka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillement, de la boisson, du charbon de bois et des produits cosmétiques.                                                              
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala  sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente Fatoumata   la personne assise à gauche  est vendeuse de charbon de bois elle compte acheter  30 sacs de charbon de bois à 1.500Fcfa le sac dans les villages voisins. Elle les revend à 2500FCFA le sac. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA. Le bénéfice mensuel est divisé est deux ; une partie est utilisée pour les dépenses de la famille et l’autre est réinjectée dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The women of the Kotognontala group are married. On average, they are 37 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the city of Fana, town of Guégnaka, prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another through relatives, neighbors, and friendship. They sell clothing, beverages, wood coal, and cosmetics.

This is the ninth group loan for the women of the Kotognontala group.

The client, Fatoumata, is seated at left. She sells wood coal and would like to buy 30 bags of wood coal in the neighboring villages at 1,500 FCFA per bag. She resells them at 2,500FCFA per bag. 

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 30.000 FCFA. The monthly profit is divided in two: one part is used for household expenses and the other is reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy wood coal.

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36ans, 4enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme   ROUKY (2me à droite sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt des chaussures pour  les revendre au marché et en famille. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7 500FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are married women with an average age of 36 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Kolondieba, the third administrative region of Mali. The are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to keep carrying out their business activities. This is their third loan from the institution and they plan on repaying it.

Rouky (the second from the right in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy shoes so that she can resell them at the market with her family. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 7 500 francs. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

Rokiatou Seydou (first on the left in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy condiments so that she can resell them at the market with her family. loans.name: Badenya. Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BADENYA  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KADIANA, une des Sous-préfecture de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur première prêt avec l’institution.
Mme  FATOU (1ère assise à gauche sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt des condiments et du riz pour faire de la restauration. Elle vend ses plats alimentaires au marché à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 500FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Badenya Group are married women who average 33 years of age and 4 children. They all live in polygamous families in Kadiana, one of the subprefectures in Mali's third administrative region.

They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their activities throughout the year. They are seeking their first loan from the MFI.

Mrs. Fatou is the woman sitting on the left in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy condiments and rice for her food serving business. She sells her dishes at the market, to a diverse clientele.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 10'500 (ca US$ 22) that will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments and rice

Mme MAMAKAN (1ère debout à droite sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt des  condiments et du riz  pour faire de la restauration. Elle vend ses repas à SEBLE.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17 500FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The members of the Benkelema group are married women with an average age of 36 and, on average, 3 children, who all live in polygamous families in Seble, one of the villages in Kadiana, which is a sub-prefecture of the third administrative region of Mali. The are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their business activities successfully. This is their first loan from the institution and they plan on repaying it.

Mamakan (standing on the far right in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy condiments and rice for her restaurant business. She sells her meals in Seble. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 17 500 francs. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments and rice.

loans.name: Kalifa

texts.fr:
Né vers1973 à Diandiana C/KOLONDIEBA, Kalifa  réside à KOLONDIEBA (Sous-Préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) avec  ses femmes et ses 7 enfants dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Mr Kalifa  s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat   vente des  articles divers  de boutique. il est très sollicité dans son quartier à Kolondièba. 
Fort de ses 7 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  troisième prêt, après avoir remboursé les prêts précédents. 
Kalifa  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des piles ; sucre ; cigarette, lait en poudre et thé. Il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes à Kolondièba et souvent à  Bamako. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle divers et variée.
Kalifa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in Diandiana C/Kolondièba, Kalifa lives in Kolondièba (a sub-prefecture of the third administrative region of Mali) with his wife and 7 children in a traditional family setting. Kalifa very quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, notably selling different shop articles. He is very much in demand in his district of Kolondièba. Bolstered by 7 years experience in this line of work, he is working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase his business and satisfy his ever-growing clientèle. He is on his third loan, having properly repaid his previous loans.

Kalifa plans to use his loan to buy batteries, sugar, cigarettes, powdered milk and tea. He gets his supplies from the wholesalers in Kolondièba and often in Bamako. He makes his sales for cash and sometimes for credit to a mixed and diverse clientèle. Kalifa hopes to make a monthly profit of 120 000 francs which will be used to meet his family's needs and to repay the loan, and will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy batteries, sugar, cigarettes, powdered milk and tea.

loans.name: Abdoul Karim

texts.fr:
Né en juin  1985 à KEBILA,  ABDOUL KARIM  y réside (Sous-Préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) avec son  enfant et sa femme dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Mr ABDOUL KARIM s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  bœufs.  Il est très sollicité au marché de Kebila et surtout les jours de foire. 
Fort de ses 6 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  cinquième prêt, après avoir remboursé les prêts  précédents. 
ABDOUL KARIM compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des bœufs. Il s’approvisionne chez les éleveurs dans les villages avoisinants. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché généralement aux bouchers.
ABDOUL KARIM espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 140.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Abdoul Karim was born in June 1985 in Kebila, a subprefecture in Mali's third administrative region, where he resides in a traditional family, with his child and wife.

Early on, he got interested in money-earning businesses, in particular buying and selling oxen. He's very much sought after at the market in Kebila, especially on fair days.

Backed by six years of experience in this field, he collaborates with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to bolster his working capital and satisfy an ever-increasing clientele. He's seeking his fifth loan, and the previous ones were repaid without problems.

Abdoul Karim intends to use his loan to buy oxen. He gets his supplies from breeders in the surroundings villages. He sells at the market for cash and sometimes on credit, usually to butchers.

He hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 140'000 (ca US$ 280), to be used to provide for his family, repay the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy oxen

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Van, 33 years old, lives in Tien Tra, Bac Ninh where carpentry is one of the most common occupations. Her husband has been a professional carpenter  for 10 years. Besides doing the usual housework, Van raises poultry and plants trees to increase income for her family. On average, her family has a monthly income of 15,000,000 VND. 

However, this income is not enough for her family of five. All three of her children attend school, with a daughter and son in high school, and her other daughter is in primary school. Now, Van would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to purchase wood. Like many other mothers, Van hopes to have a stable income as she can send her children to university, build a new house and have a large and modern carpentry workshop. 

As a hardworking, careful and proactive woman, Van believes that she can efficiently manage her family's carpentry workshop and fulfill her dreams. This will be her fourth loan, and the revenue arising from it will be used to improve the family's living conditions and expand the carpentry workshop. 

Van is the leader of a group containing five members who are listed below:

Thanh, 29 years old, is a mother of two children. Her main work is as a carpenter. However, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to raise chickens. She expects that she will generate more income by selling eggs and chickens.

Phan is a farmer who was born in 1964. She would love to borrow 10,080,000 VND to raise chickens.

Nha is the youngest member of the group. She was born in 1991 and already has two children. She wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to invest in her carpentry workshop.

Similarly, Hoa would love to borrow 10,080,000 VND to spend on her carpentry workshop. She is a young mother of two children and also a skillful carpenter.

Hat, who was born in 1977, wants to borrow 10,976,000 VND to purchase scrap iron. Her main job is trading scrap metal.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Ngoc Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan is 35 years old. Her husband is a skilled shoemaker. Lan helps her husband manage her family's shoe shop. The family's monthly income is around VND 12,000,000. 

Lan has three children. The oldest son is a carpenter while the other children are learning in primary school. Lan's challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to invest in her business. Her dream is that her family business would grow and be sustainable. 

As a hard-working, passionate businesswoman, Lan wants to have enough money to start up a clothes shop and to open a carpentry workshop for her oldest son. This loan is one of steps that will take her closer to her dream. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed VND 5,152,000 to buy shoes for her shop. She always wants to expand her business. Thus, this time, she would love to borrow VND 8,288,000 to invest in her business, for instance to buy more shoes.

Other members who are part of Lan's group are included in the below list:
•	Besides working in a factory, Hong wishes to raise more income for her family by feeding chickens. As a result, she wants to borrow VND 5,152,000  to buy chickens and poultry food.
•	Phuong is a hairdresser. She would like to borrow VND 8,288,000 to buy tools and shampoo for her barber shop.
•	Lien was born in 1973. She is an owner of a clothes shop. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy more clothes for her shop.

loans.use: to invest in her family's shoe shop.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 42 years of age and is an experienced farmer from a rural village of Ba Phnum district, Prey Veng. She has three children who are married and live separately around the province, so she only lives with her husband. To meet the needs of her family, Lan and her husband work together on their own farm, where she primarily grows rice both for food and sales. Farming is the important source of their income. 

As she is living in the off-grid area and has no electricity for use in the household, Lan would like to obtain a loan to buy a set of solar home systems to install on the top roof of her home. After this initial investment, Lan hopes to have clean energy to support her household appliances such as light, TV and radio, so everyone in her family can even work or study at night. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan's goal, HKL has provided a special interest rate that is different from its general loan products. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a set of solar home systems to install on the top roof of her home.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Suong is 52 years old and a widowed mother of four children. She earns a living via cassava farming, her sole source of income, which generated about 36,200 KHR per day. She has been operating this business for ten years. Including this loan, Suong is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loans has enabled her to keep her kids in school, and provide three daily meals and decent clothes for them. For this cycle, she will use her loan to support her existing business, lease an additional plot of farmland to grow more cassava, pay for labor costs, and buy insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield with a good selling price so that she can renovate her house.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs and buy insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 25-year-old hardworking man living in Hoima, Uganda. He has been in the transportation business, specifically riding a bicycle, for three years. With the proceeds, he has been able to buy land, and his dream is to venture into a piggery and also to grow crops so as to earn more income. Like most riders in the country, he is challenged by the high cost of fuel and poor roads, especially during the rainy season when they become almost impassable, but he says he is not giving up until he becomes economically stable. Emmanuel intends to use the loan to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.use: to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.name: Rosas De Villa Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE VILLA INGENIO” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ceferina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de papas fritas, tejido de chompas, venta de macramé, venta de artículos varios, venta de celulares, venta de gomitas de chocolates, servicio de guardería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ceferina es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió al observar que este producto era muy bien comercializado en el mercado y que sería un buen negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Bolivia – Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación.
texts.en:
The ROSAS DE VILLA INGENIO Communal Bank will begin its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch Regional Center. It is made up of nine members and is managed by a board of directors presided over by Sra. Ceferina as president. The businesses owned by members of the bank vary.  Among them are a neighborhood store, the sale of fired potatoes, the production of woven sweaters, the sale of macramé, the sale of various goods, the sale of cell phones, the sale of chocolate gummy worms, and security services.

The loans the members receive will benefit small businesses. Sra. Ceferina states that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago through a friend’s invitation. The friend was already a member. Currently Ceferina has a business selling clothing. She revealed that she started this business after observing that this type of merchandise sold well in the market and would be a good business. 

The loan she is requesting will enable her to increase her capital and purchase more clothes. She will buy them from wholesale sellers at the Bolivia-Peru border and later will sell them in her sales space. This kind of work enables her to generate resources to support her family because she is in a common-law relationship and has two children.

When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training workshops.

loans.use: to purchase clothing,

loans.name: Fortaleza De Adelita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA DE ADELITA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de busos, costura de busos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela es integrante, ella indica que hace séptimo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de busos; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió al trabajar de operario en un taller de tejido, posteriormente, con el primer crédito que obtuvo en Pro Mujer decide emprender un espacio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Fortaleza de Adelita” [“Strength of Adelita”] is starting its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, through the Germán Busch regional office. The communal bank is made up of eight members, and is directed by a board of directors, of which Adela is the president. The businesses of the members are varied and include making sweaters and selling food.

This loan will be used in some small businesses of which Adela is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago at the invitation of her sister-in-law, who is a member. Adela’s business is making and selling sweaters. She says that she learned this business from working as a machine operator in a weaving workshop. Later, with the first loan she received from Pro Mujer, she decided to start her own business.

Adela is requesting this loan to increase the capital of her business by buying wool, which she will buy from the distributors in the city of El Alto. After she makes the sweaters, she will sell them from her sales space. This work allows her to earn income to support her family, as she is in a common-law relationship and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Adela replies that she likes the health and training services.

loans.use: to buy wool for her sweater business.

loans.name: Las Legendarias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS LEGENDARIAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felipa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de calzados de cholita, producción de faldas, agricultura, venta de pollo, venta de fruta, venta de comida, venta de dulces, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felipa es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años, al observar que este producto se vendía con amplia cobertura en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, fideo) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago.

En la fotografía no se encuentra una señora porque tuvo que ingresar a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The “Las Lengendarias” communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Felipa is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied, and among them are selling traditional “Cholita” footwear, producing skirts, farming, selling chicken, selling fruit, selling food, selling sweets, and a neighborhood store.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Felipa is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one year.  She joined by invitation from an adviser with the institution who went to visit her at her house.  She currently has a business selling food.  She says that she undertook this business on her own initiative several years ago when she saw that this products was sold widely in the market. 

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital to buy rice, cooking oil, and noodles that she will get from the distribution stores in the city of El Alto.  She will later make the food and sell it at her sales space.  This way of working will allow her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the payment meetings.

One lady is not in the photo because she had a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Playa Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PLAYA AZUL” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso y tunta, compra y venta de ganado, venta de leche, venta de pescado, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de sus padres , ya que era un negocio familiar, posterior a tener su primer hijo decide emplear esta forma de trabajo como generadora de ingresos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de redes de pesca) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente implementará para la pesca, misma que luego comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es vive en unión libre y tiene nueve hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que se realizan en el grupo.

En la fotografía no esta una señora porque se fue a trabajar.
texts.en:
The "Playa Azul" communal bank will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Regional Office. The group is made up of eight members and led by a directive of which Olga is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied including cheese and freeze-dried potatoes sales, livestock sales, milk sales, fish sales, and food sales. 

The loan to be taken out will benefit the small micro-entrepreneurs where Olga is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, having entered upon invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling fish and it is known that she learned this business from her parents since it had been a family business. After having her first child she decided to work in this manner in order to generate income. 

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital through the purchase of fishing nets that will be purchased from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. She will then use them to fish so that she can then sell them at her stall. This type of work allows her to generate income to sustain her family given that she is part of a civil union and has nine children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings that are carried out in the group. One woman is not in the photo because she had to leave for work.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Momen

texts.en:
Momen is a 23-year-old single man from a small village near Rafah city.  He lives in a small simple house with his family.  Momen owns a small library for selling stationary and provides some services for students like copying and typing.  He would like to improve his business but he does not have enough money.

Momen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more stationary products and also buy a new copying machine for his store.  By taking this loan, Momen will be able to increase his sales and also his income.

Momen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more stationary products and a new copying machine for his store

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man. He has four children, with ages ranging from four years to ten years. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail shop where he sells sweets, biscuits, bananas and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years.

His primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of products. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to add stock of sweets, biscuits, bananas and other items.

His business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will sustain his family economically and grow his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: add stock of sweets, biscuits, bananas and other items

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a  Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself as an experienced person. She operates a retail business where she sells handbags, socks, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.  She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of hand bags, socks. Her business goal is to prosper within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open other branches of her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add stock of handbags, socks

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as a stable person. He operates a barber shop where he cuts hair. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in an area suited to the business and his primary customers are men. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a new hair cutting machine and pay utility bills. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a new hair cutting machine and pay utility bills

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam is requesting a new loan to buy copper processing tools to expand his business and satisfy his customers. Tam's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy copper processing tools to expand his business and satisfy his customers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 54 year-old single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be an ambitious and determined person. She operates a retail shop where she offers document printing and photocopying services. She has been involved in this business for a year.  Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy printing papers, cartridge and other materials for use in her business. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy printing papers, cartridges and other materials

loans.name: Isatu   M

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Isatu from Waterloo2, western rural in Freetown, in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. In 2003, Isatu established her retail business. She began her business, and was trained, because she did not go to school. She works at the business 11 hours, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and proper business location.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil and general stock for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to open a big store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Here is Mama from Liberia. She lives in Sinkor. She is 44 years old and she is married to a security man. She did not attend school. 

For seven years, Mama has been selling soap in the local market in order to help her children in her home. She started this business with a little amount of money from her husband. She is handling her own money and she has the happier things she enjoys in her business. 

Mama is requesting a loan to purchase more soap for her business. She wants to expand her business and own a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Fatmata from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. For the past 6 years Fatmata established her retail business. She began her business to create a permanent source of income for her family. She works at the business 9 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that her business is doing well because out of the profit she is able to take care of her family.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks and pure water to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more than even. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarette, drinks and pure water to expand her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther live in Sinkor, Liberia. She is 49 years old and married with four children, between 13 and 20 years old. Only one child is in school and lives at home. Esther did not attend school. For the past seven years she has been selling rice, pepper, oil, etc in the local market. She has insufficient capital to meet the needs of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food products to expand her business. She started this business with little money which she received from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She enjoys the flow of her customers and having money in her home makes her proud. Her wish is to live a better life in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, etc. to expand her business,

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Fatu from Waterloo2, western rural in Freetown, in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. In 2006, Fatu established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to create income for her daily living. She works at the business from 8:00 A.M. until 5:30 P.M. six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business, and proper business location.

Fatu requires a loan in order to purchase more charcoal for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and to increase her business. In the future, Fatu plans to change her business to a provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages,to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Be

texts.en: Be is requesting a new loan to buy greater quantity of coffee products and soft drinks. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her cafe and increasing sales, and that it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy greater quantity of coffee products and soft drinks

loans.name: Sokhhea

texts.en: Sokhhea is a 33-year-old mother of three kids, two schoolchildren and one little kid, residing in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. For the sake of her entire household, especially her kids, she does rice-cropping and cassava-trading business--she buys others’ yield and re-sells it. This is the business that she has had for 13 years. This is the first loan for Sokhhea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now seeking the first loan to buy others’ cassava yield to resale. She hopes that she can gain more income, better than before.

loans.use: to buy others’ cassava yield to re-sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en: Irakli is 28 years old and lives in the Zugdidi district. He is married and lives with his wife, two daughters and mother-in-law. Irakli works as a salesperson at the local store and gets a small monthly salary. He wants to supplement his family's income by renovating his house so he can rent it out, but he has been unable to get a loan from several local financial institutions to pay for renovations. That is why he is requesting a loan from Kiva and Credo, which help people who do not qualify for conventional loans. Irakli will use the loan to buy the materials he needs to renovate his house. He hopes that renting out the rooms will be profitable and will increase his income, so that he and his family members can improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate the house so that it can be rented out.

loans.name: Luriana

texts.en: Luriana is currently in the canary breeding business. According to her, this type of activity not only is something she enjoys doing but it has also proved to be profitable from the start. “I sell the canaries in some pet stores in Greece,” she said. In addition, she has been doing something else, selling toys. She wants to stock up on toy inventories and holiday ornaments and she needs your help to achieve this.

loans.use: To buy toys and holiday ornaments to sell.

loans.name: Murtoz

texts.ru: Муртоз глубоко духовный и верующий человек. Муртоз растет четырех детей. Двоих дочерей и двоих сыновей. Старшему сыну 18 лет он помогает своим родителям присматривать за братьями и сестрой. Муртоз кормит свою семью за счет продажи своей деятельности растениеводства. Он земледелием увлечен уже много лет. Муртоз занимается посевом разных культур. На данный момент он хочет посадить пшеницу, чтобы реализовать посев на планированное количество урожая, у Муртоз не хватает средств. Он хочет купить семена. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. В надежде, что вы ему поможете!
texts.en: Murtoz is a deeply spiritual and religious person.  Murtoz is raising four children - two daughters and two sons.  The oldest son is 18 years, and he helps his parents by looking after his brother and sisters.  Murtoz provides for his family through sales from his agricultural business.  He has been involved in farming for many years.  Murtoz plants various types of cultures.  At the present time, he wants to plant wheat to make sure that the sowing results in the expected harvest numbers, but does not have enough money.  He wants to purchase seeds.  He requested this loan to achieve this goal.  He hopes that you will help him!

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Shereen

texts.en:
Shereen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.
Shereen is a 32 year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She is a mother of four sons and one daughter. Her husband owns a workshop for making car chairs. It has been working for two years. It is a good business and earns a good income, but still needs a lot to improve the workshop. 
Shereen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy more textile for his workshop. By taking this loan Shereen's husband will increase his productivity and also his income.

loans.use: to buy more textile for her husbands workshop

loans.name: Radio Animas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RADIO ANIMAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mauricia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, ayudante de cocina, tejido de mantas, servicio de albañilería, venta de alfombras, venta de frutillas, tejido de macramé de mantas, venta de jugo de naranja.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mauricia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas a macramé; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió lo emprendió conjuntamente sus amigas, ya que ellas le enseñaron la forma de tejido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The “RADIO ANIMAS” communal bank will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional office. It is comprised of nine members and it's headed by a board of directors which is presided by Mauricia. The members of the communal bank run various types of business, and among them are fruit sales, kitchen assistant, weaving blankets, masonry, carpet sales, strawberry sales, making macrame blankets, and orange juice sales.

The loan they obtained will benefit this group of microentrepreneurs of which Mauricia is a member. She states that she has been a part of Pro Mujer for four years, and she joined by invitation from her sister-in-law who's a member of the institution. She currently owns a business making macrame blankets. She reports that she started this business alongside her female friends, since they taught her how to make the blankets.

The loan that she will now obtain is to increase her working capital (by purchasing wool). She'll buy the wool from the distributing companies of the town of El Alto, and after making the blankets she'll sell them in her sales stand. This line of work allows her to earn profits in order to support her family, since she's married and has five children.

When asked about what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the trainings and the health services.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Central De Cachilaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CENTRAL CACHILAYA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, tejido de mantas, costura de blusas, venta de queso, venta de gallinas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que visitó su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de busos; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de hace varios años de un trabajo anterior, posteriormente decide emprende su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que se realizan en el grupo.
texts.en:
The “Central Cachilaya” communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Verónica is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied, and among them are selling fish, weaving blankets, making blouses, selling cheese, and selling chickens.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Verónica is a member.  She says that this is the first time that she has been a member of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from an adviser with the institution who went to visit her at her house.  She currently has a business of making sportswear.  She learned this business several years ago from a previous job.  Later, she decided to undertake her own work space. 

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital to buy wool that she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto.  After making the sportswear, she will sell it at her sales space.  This way of working will allow her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the savings that the group realizes.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun is 46 years old, married, and a loving father of two grown-up children. He owns a small parcel of land, where he grows rice and cassavas that he can sell in his community or at the local markets. His wife and children are his great support in his farming works.  Farming is the major source of income and he has been doing this for nearly 25 years. He is able to earn a profit of KHR40,000 per day.

To further help him develop his farming business, he is asking for a loan to buy one cow for the maintenance of the rice fields. In the future, he hopes that his business will continue to grow and gain more income to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one cow for the maintenance of the rice fields.

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ty is 68 years of age and a farmer from Santuk district, Kampong Thom province. To take care of his daily needs, Ty is engaged in the farming business and works as a construction worker around the province. His earnings from the two businesses allow him to provide his family members with a moderate living. Ty has five children, three of whom are currently employed in various careers in Phnom Penh.

Ty would like this loan to buy a motorcycle for his employed children to commute to their workplaces. This purchase will help them to reduce their traveling expenses and save more for their future needs. Ty is very grateful for loan support.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his employed children commuting to their workplaces.

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.ru: Тахмина добрая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Тахмина занимается виноградарством уже более 20 лет. Она также перерабатывает виноград и изготавливает изюм. Свою продукцию она продает на местном рынке, где имеет своих регулярных клиентов. Тахмина имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Она работает упорно для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги на жизнь. Ее супруг не имеет постоянного источника дохода. Он помогает жене по введению бизнеса. Тахмина должна купить зимнюю одежду для своих детей, так как они не имеют зимнюю одежду. Тахмина запрашивает займ на сумму 1700 сомони для покупки зимней одежды для своих детей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Takhmina is a kind woman.  She is married and raising two adolescent children.  Takhmina has been involved in growing grapevines for over 20 years.  She also processes grapes and makes raisins.  She sells her products at a local market, where she has her own regular clients.  Takhmina has an additional income from animal husbandry.  She works diligently to earn money for living.  Her husband does not have a regular source of income.  He helps his wife with running the business.  Takhmina has to purchase winter clothing for her children because they do not have winter clothing.  Takhmina is requesting a loan in the amount of 1700 somoni to purchase winter clothing for her children.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing for her children

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a farmer living in the Eldoret area of North Rift Kenya. He is married and has 3 children all of whom are of school going age. He has been in farming for 8 years where he produces and sells milk, tea, and maize. Besides farming, he has a transportation business (border-border). He enjoys farming because by it he can meet his families needs through agricultural earnings. His challenge is a lack of adequate funding.
Hillary says that he chose Juhudi Kilimo so that they can fund him to boost his poultry project. During training he learnt how Juhudi Kilimo works with farmers to boost their working capital.This loan will enable him to diversify from dairy farming only and add poultry farming, which will boost his income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchasing poultry.

loans.name: Shingimizi Group

texts.fr:
J.Alice fait partie du groupe Shingimizi. Elle habite  à Gitega .Elle  a 31 ans est marié à J.Marie. un charpentier. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 2 à 17 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane depuis 12 ans.           

Elle est à son huitième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bidons de  bière de banane, de 20 litres chacun, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait acheter  2 parcelles pour ses enfants et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Alice is a member of the Shingimizi group. She lives in Gitega. She is 31 years old and married to J. Marie, a carpenter. Together they have three children, from ages two to 17. 

She has been selling banana beer for 12 years. 

She is on her eighth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy 20-liter drums of banana beer to resell and earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to buy two parcels of land for her children and also see them study.

loans.use: to buy 20-liter drums of banana beer to resell

loans.name: Inyishu Group

texts.fr:
Tatu fait partie du groupe  Inyishu  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 45 et est mariée à  Hussein, un soudeur. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 6 à 20 ans, dont 6 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge  2 enfants, membres de sa famille élargie, qui étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des habits, et des légumes (tomate, oignon,…) depuis  2 ans. 

Elle est à  son  quatrième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  et une grande quantité de  légumes (tomates, oignons,…) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et construire une maison.
texts.en:
Tatu is part of the Inyishu group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 45 years old and is married to Hussein, a welder. Together they have 7 children aged 6-20 years, of whom six are in school.
She has two other children under her care, members of her extended family, who both attend school.

She has been trading clothes and vegetables (tomatoes, onions, ...) for the past two years.

This is her fourth credit loan with Turame. Once the Kiva loan is obtained, she will increase her working capital and buy a lot of clothes and a lot of vegetables (tomatoes, onions, ...) for retail sales, to earn more.

In coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a lot of clothes and a lot of vegetables (tomatoes, onions, ...) for retail sales, to earn more.

loans.name: Ingabo Group

texts.fr:
Agathe fait partie du groupe  Ingabo et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 44 et est mariée à  Jean, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 10 à 25 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de ciment  depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à  son  cinquième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de sacs de ciment à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Agathe is part of the Ingabo group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 44 years old and is married to Jean, a merchant. Together they have five children aged 10 to 25 years, of whom four attend school.

She has been in the cement business for 20 years.

This is her fifth credit loan with Turame. Once she obtains the Kiva loan, she will increase her working capital and buy a lot of bags of cement for retail sales,to earn more.

In coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land and see to her children's education.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy a lot of bags of cement for retail sales,to earn more.

loans.name: Dieu Merci Group

texts.fr:
Egide fait partie du groupe  Dieu Merci et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 35 et est marié à  Béatrice, une étudient. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 1 à 7 ans, dont 1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce  des  ustensiles de cuisine (assiette, verres, bouteilles,…) depuis  13ans. 

Il est à  son  cinquième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’assiettes, de verres, de bouteilles,…  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait devenir importateur des ustensiles de cuisines et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Egide is part of the Dieu Merci group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 35 years old and is married to Beatrice, a student. Together they have two children aged one and seven years, of whom one is in school.

He has been trading kitchen utensils (plates, glasses, bottles, ...) for the past 13 years.

This is his fifth credit loan with Turame. Once he obtains the Kiva loan, he will increase his working capital and buy lots of plates, glasses, bottles, ... for resale, to earn more.

In coming years, he wants to become an importer of kitchen utensils and see to his children's education.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy lots of plates, glasses, bottles, ... for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Murikana Group

texts.fr:
Modeste fait partie du groupe  Murikana et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 28 et est mariée à  Prosper, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 3 à 8 ans, dont 1étudie.

Elle fait le commerce des  matériaux de construction depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à  son  cinquième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de fer à béton, des tubes servant dans la fabrication des portes,… à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle,  construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Modeste is part of the Murikana group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 28 years old and is married to Prosper, a merchant. Together they have three  children aged 3 to 8 years,of whom one is in school.

She has been trading construction materials for the past 10 years.

IThis is her fifth credit loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she obtains, she will increase her capital and buy a lot of rebars and tubings used to manufacture doors, ... for resale, to earn more.

In coming years, she would like to buy a plotof land, build a home and see to her children's education.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy a lot of rebars and tubing used to manufacture doors, ... for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Dukomere Group

texts.fr:
Zainabu fait partie du groupe  Dukomere et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 39 ans et est mariée à  Rémy, un agriculteur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 13 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des habits et des tomates depuis  8 ans. 

Elle est à  son  septième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  et  de  tomates à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Zainabu is a member of the Dukomere group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 39 and is married to Rémy, a farmer. Together they have four children, from 1 to 13 years of age, three of whom are in school.
She has been a reseller of clothing and tomatoes for eight years. She is on her seventh loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she hopes to obtain, she will increase her working capital and will purchase a large quantity of outfits and tomatoes, in order to increase her income.
In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land, and to see her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of outfits and tomatoes for resale, to increase her income.

loans.name: Muamuko Group

texts.fr:
Arthémon fait partie du groupe Muamuko et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 53 et est marié  à  Gloriose un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 11 à  13 ans, tous  étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz, huile de palme, sucre,…) depuis  4 ans. 

Il est à  son  quatrième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  kilos  de riz, de haricot, de sucre et de l’huile de palme à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années , il voudrait devenir grossiste du riz, du haricot, de l’huile de palme,…  et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Arthémon is part of the Muamuko group, and lives in Bujumbura. He is 53 years of age and married to Gloriose, a farmer. Together they have four children aged between 11 and 13. All of their children are at school.

He has worked selling store items (rice, palm oil, sugar) for four years, and this is his fourth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he receives, he plans to increase his capital and buy many kilos of rice, beans, sugar and palm oil, which he will resell to earn more. Over the coming years, he would like to become a wholesaler of rice, beans and palm oil and see his children continue studying.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy many kilos of rice, beans, sugar and palm oil, which he will resell to earn more.

loans.name: Vyukakare Group

texts.fr:
Germaine fait partie du groupe  Vyukakare et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 48 et est mariée  à  Gervais, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés  dont  2  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane  depuis  2 ans. 

Elle est à  son troisième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bière de banane  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Germaine is a member of the Vyukakare group and lives in Gitega. She is 48 years old and married to Gervais, a shopkeeper. They have three children together, 2 of whom attend school. 

She has sold banana beer for a living for two years. 

She is on her third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she is seeking, she will aim to boost her working capital and purchase a large quantity of banana beer for re-sale, so that she may earn more money.

loans.use: to boost business capital, and buy a large quantity of banana beer for re-sale

loans.name: Haguruka Ii Group

texts.fr:
Goreth fait partie du groupe  Haguruka II  et  habite à Ngozi. Elle a 40 et est mariée  à  Balthazar un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 6 à 25 ans  tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  banane et de bière de banane  depuis  16 ans. 

Elle est à  son  troisième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour préparer une grande quantité de bière de banane  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle voudrait  acheter une  deuxième vache et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Goreth is a part of the group "Haguruka II" and lives in Ngozi. She is 40 years old and married to Balthazar, a merchant. Together they have seven children, from 6 to 25 years old, all students. 

Goreth has been doing commerce in banana beer for sixteen years. 

She is on her third Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to make a large quantity of banana beer to sell, so as to earn more 

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a second cow and see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of bananas to make a large quantity of banana beer to sell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Tumenyane Group

texts.fr:
Cassien  fait partie du groupe  Tumenyane  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 52 ans  et est marié  à  Helene  une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 12 a 27 ans  tous étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de  clous et de serrures   depuis  5 ans. 

C’est   son  premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  clous et beaucoup de serrures  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter une  parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Cassien is part of the group Tumenyane and lives in Bujumbura. He is 52 years old and married to Helene, a farmer. Together they have five children, from 12 to 27 years old, all students. 

Cassien has been doing commerce in nails and locks for five years. 

This is his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of nails and many locks to sell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a parcel of land and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of nails and many locks to sell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Claudien

texts.en:
Claudine is 48 years old. He is married with five children. he would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for growing maize. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that he can acquire machines and tractors that will increase his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 31 years old. He is married with two children. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest profits from his farming into his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is a 23-year-old woman. She describes herself as an ambitious person. She operates a retail shop where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances and changes in fashion, which affect sales. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes for resale. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will excel in her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Emzari

texts.en: Emzari is 21 years old and from Kutaisi city. He lives alone and works as a waiter at the restaurant and gets 280 GEL per month. He is a hardworking and diligent man who is now requesting 1300 USD in order to purchase a second-hand car and start a transportation business inter-town. He will serve local people as a private taxi driver and generate income in his spare-time. After several unsuccessful attempts, Emzari applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. The loan is very important for Emzari to be able to provide taxi service and gain income for his further development. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start taxi business

loans.name: Dusabe Group

texts.fr:
