Scholastique fait partie du groupe  Dusabe  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a  50 ans et est mariée  à  Ndayi un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants  âgés de 9 à 30 ans,dont 5 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  chèvres  depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à  son quinzième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chèvres  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Scholastique is part of the group "Dusabe" and lives in Gitega. She is 50 years old and married to Ndayi, a mason. Together they have eight children, from 9 to 30 years old, of whom five are students. 

Scholastique has been doing commerce in goats for twenty years. 

She is on her fifteenth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many goats to sell, so as to earn more 

In the coming years, she would like to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many goats to sell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Abaduzikivi Group

texts.fr:
M Goreth fait partie du groupe  Abaduzakivi  et  habite à Ngozi. Elle a 26 ans  et est mariée  à  Jean un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 1 à 15 ans  dont 6 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de  boutique (huile de palme, savon, piles,…)  depuis  5 ans. 

Elle est à  son troisième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (huile de palme, savon, pile,…) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle  voudrait  acheter une  parcelle, construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
M Goreth is part of the Abaduzakivi group and lives in Ngozi. She is 26 years old and married to Jean, a shopkeeper. They have 7 children together ranging from 1 to 15 years old, and 6 of their children are attending school. 

She has run a small store (selling palm oil, soap, batteries, etc.) for 5 years. This is her third loan through Turame. With the loan she receives from Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy lots of items for her store (palm oil, soap, batteries, etc.) to re-sell in order to earn more money. 

In the next few years, she would like to buy some land, build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and lots of items for her store (palm oil, soap, batteries...) to re-sell and make more money.

loans.name: Duzikivi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Xavia fait partie du groupe  Duzikivi II  et  habite à Ngozi. Il a 38 et est marié  à  Patricie, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 8 mois à 16 ans  dont  4  étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz, huile de palme, tabac,…) depuis  2 ans. 

Il  est à  son troisième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d'articles de sa boutique(riz, huile de palme, tabac,…) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il voudrait ouvrir une boutique et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Xavia is part of the Duzikivi II group, and lives in Ngozi. He is 38 years of age and married to Patricie, a retailer. Together they have six children between the ages of 8 months and 16 years. Four of their children are at school.

Xavia has worked selling store items (rice, palm oil, tobacco) for 2 years, and this is his third loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he receives, he plans to increase his capital and buy lots of items for his store (rice, palm oil, tobacco), which he will resell to earn more. Over the coming years, Xavia would like to open a store and see his children continue studying.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy lots of items for his store (rice, palm oil, tobacco), which he will resell to earn more.

loans.name: Ruhembe Group

texts.fr:
Moise fait partie du groupe  Ruhembe  et  habite à Cibitoke. Il a  32 ans  et est mariée  à  Francine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant  de  9 mois.

Il est  tailleur  et fait le commerce de pagnes depuis  7 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  6 paires de pagnes  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il  voudrait  avoir un magasin de tissus, faire le commerce des poissons et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Moise is part of the Ruhembe group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 32 years old and married to Francine, a farmer. Together, they have one child who is 9 months old.

He is a tailor and has been selling pagnes (traditional wrap arounds) for seven years.

This is his first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he receives, he will increase his capital and buy six pagnes to resell in order to earn more. 

In the next few years, he would like to have a fabric store, sell fish, and see his children study.

loans.use: to buy six pagnes to resell

loans.name: Abasangirakiyago Group

texts.fr:
Yvette fait partie du groupe  Abasangirakiyago  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a  35 ans  et est mariée  à  Gabriel, un dessinateur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 9 à  15 ans, tous étudient.  

Elle  fait le commerce de bière  industrielle, bière de banane te limonade dans son bistrot depuis  2 ans. 

Elle  est  à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de bière  industrielle, de limonade et 30 l de bière de banane  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle  voudrait  acheter  un terrain cultivable et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Yvette is a member of the  Abasangirakiyago group and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and married to Gabriel, a designer. Together they have 4 children between the ages of 9 and 15, all of whom attend school.

Yvette has been selling beer, banana beer, and lemonade in her pub for 2 years. She is on her fourth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she obtains, she will increase her business capital and purchase several cases of beer, lemonade, and 30L of banana beer to resell and increase her profits. In the coming years, she hopes to purchase land to cultivate and to ensure her children are educated.

loans.use: to increase her business capital and purchase several cases of beer, lemonade, and 30L of banana beer to resell in order to increase her profits

loans.name: Koribirama Group

texts.fr:
Gloriose fait partie du groupe  Koribirama et  habite à Gitega. Elle a  48 ans  et est mariée  à  Tharcisse, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants  âgés de 5 a 25 ans dont 6  étudient.  

Elle fait le commerce de bière  de banane  depuis  1 année. 

Elle est  à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bière  de banane  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Gloriose is a member of the Koribirama Group and lives in Gitega. She is 48 years old and is married to Tharcisse, a merchant. Together they have eight children between the ages of five and 25 years old, six of whom are studying.

She has been selling banana beer for one year, and is on her eleventh loan with Turame. With the loan she receives from KIVA, Gloriose plans to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of banana beer that she will resell to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of banana beer that she will resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a 32-year-old single woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For ten years she has operated a food stall to sell noodles eaten with pork-pie and meat to people in her community.

Loan would like a loan to purchase new furniture for her stall and good quality food ingredients in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her stall and ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en: Trinh would like to take a further loan to buy confectionery and soft drinks to sell from her store. Trinh's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of food, such as confectionery and soft drinks

loans.name: Buhumuriro Group

texts.en:
The story was given by Gabriel, aged 38 years old and married with six children aged 14,12,10, 8, 6, and 4. Three of them attend school and he is in charge of paying school fees for them. He is an agricultural produce dealer, especially maize and groundnuts; he also does farming to supplement his income.

Gabriel borrowed 1,000,000 UGX (one million shillings) from Ugafode previously to invest in his business--now he wants 1,500,000 UGX to buy more produce so he can get more returns.

Gabriel’s dream is to buy a vehicle to transport his produce from different areas to market areas. His main challenges include limited capital, price fluctuations, and bad weather, among others.

loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Blessed Families & Friends Care Group

texts.en:
Charles, aged 34, is married and has three children.  Two of them are school-aged.  Charles is in charge of providing their school fees. He is a farmer and a produce dealer. his major sources of income. Charles borrowed UGX.500,000= (Five Hundred thousand shillings) from Ugafode previously to expand his business.  He now wants more money, through the group, to invest in his agricultural produce business so he can get more returns.

Charles’ dream is to have a modern family house and pay school fees for his children.  However, he has challenges of limited capital, price fluctuations, and bad weather.  

The eleventh person squatting in the middle is the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Samson is married and has seven children. He also cares for two orphans from the area. He works as a pastor, serving two gospel churches, and as a community mobilizer, organizing local groups in the area. In addition to this work, Samson also farms, and is currently growing maize, sweet potatoes, kale, sunflower, amaranth, and tomatoes, as well as rearing cows and chickens. He likes beekeeping because honey is a nutritious food, and the bees will pollinate his sunflowers, leading to higher yields and a higher income. 

This is Samson’s first loan, and he plans to use the income from his hives to educate his children, as well as improve his land by adding more trees for his bees to forage on. Samson’s hope for the future is to improve his housing, start a bank account, and reduce the amount of times his children have to skip school days due to lack of fee payments. 

Samson would like to thank his Kiva lenders “for the support through this loan for I believe this is moving me from one level to another especially in supporting the orphans to feel they have belonging.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives and works close to Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania, and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Daniel is married and has seven children. Daniel volunteers as a health worker and a veterinarian, while his wife runs a small kiosk business. He and his wife are also taking care of four orphans whose parents have passed away. Daniel has been farming for four years, and is currently growing tomatoes, maize, beans, lentils, and sunflowers on his land. 

This is Daniel’s first loan, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to expand his business and pay school fees for his kids. His hope for the future is to see his children highly educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Этого молодого жителя города Душанбе зовут Ахмад. Ему 21 год. Он женат и является отцом годовалого ребенка. Ахмад водитель. Он зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги такси вот уже 3 года. Он единственный кормилец семьи. Ахмад работает с раннего утра до вечера, чтобы прокормить семью. Он всегда хорошо следит за машиной, чтобы привлечь клиентов, а также чтобы его клиентам было комфортно в его машине. Сейчас Ахмад собирается сделать тонировку стёкол своего автомобиля. Для этой цели он просит кредит. Он очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: This young resident of Dushanbe's name is Ahmad. He is 21 years old. He is married and the father of a one-year-old child. Ahmad is a driver. He has been earning a living by driving a taxi for three years. He is the only breadwinner in the family. Ahmad works from early morning until evening to feed his family. He takes good care of his car in order to attract customers and help them feel comfortable. Ahmad is going to tint the glass in the car. Therefore, he is asking for a loan. He has high hopes for support.

loans.use: tint his car windows

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen was born in 1970. She lives with her family in Dong Anh, Hanoi. She has a son and a daughter. Her daughter is studying in a university and her son is a high school student. Her husband is a worker. She sells groceries to earn a living. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has worked in this job for 10 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is a lack of capital to sell groceries. Her dream is to grow her business and for her children to be able to be successful in life. This loan is one step to help her reach this dream. Yen is a hardworking woman. She also has passion for her job. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 13,298,000 VND to sell groceries. She always wants to expand her grocery store and save profits for her children’s education.

Other members who are part of Yen's group include the following:
Hoa was born in 1956. She has two children. She raises chickens to earn a living. She wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to raise chickens.
Luyen was born in 1951. She has a child. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to raise chickens.
Cham was born in 1987. She has two children. She leases courtyards to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to lease courtyards.
Huyen was born in 1985. She has two children. She sells drinks to earn a living. She wants to borrow 9,374,000 VND to sell drinks.
Cong was born in 1983. He sells motorcycles to earn a living. He wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to sell motorcycles.
Loi was born in 1952. She has two children. She is a paint retailer. She wants to borrow 10682,000 VND to sell paint.

loans.use: to sell groceries.

loans.name: Tilateñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TILATEÑAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Pacesa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de transporte, venta de coca, venta de carne de cordero, tienda de carnicería, servicio de albañilería, taller de costura, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Pacesa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás, por iniciativa propia  al observar que estos productos son muy comerciales en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tienen dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito y sus servicios.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Tilateñas” is starting its third cycle in Pro Mujer, through the Villa Adela regional office. The communal bank is made up of nine members, and is directed by a board of directors, of which Pacesa is the secretary. The businesses of the members are varied and include transport services, selling coca, selling lamb, a butcher shop, bricklaying, a sewing workshop and weaving blankets.

This loan will be used in some small businesses of which Pacesa is a member. She says that this is her first time joining Pro Mujer, and that she joined at the invitation of a promoter who came to see her at her house. Pacesa’s business is selling vegetables. She says that she learned this business a number of years ago on her own, when she noticed that vegetables sold well in the market.

Pacesa is requesting this loan to increase the capital of her business by buying vegetables, which she will buy from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. She will then sell them from her sales space. This work allows her to earn income to support her family, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Pacesa replies that she likes the lending division and its services.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale prices to sell in her business.

loans.name: Candelaria Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CANDELARIA” iniciará el trigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Estela es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frescos, taller de electricidad, venta de café, venta de chamarras, venta de verduras, venta de calzados, venta de ropa, venta de artefactos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Estela es integrante, ella indica que hace doce años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de víveres (arroz, azúcar, cereales, etc.); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás, por iniciativa propia  al observar que estos productos son muy comerciales en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tienen un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los servicio de salud y crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Candelaria” communal bank will begin its thirty-first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela regional center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Estela is the secretary.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied, and among them are selling soft drinks, electrical shop, selling coffee, selling jackets, selling vegetables, selling shoes, selling clothes, and selling appliances.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Estela is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years.  She joined by invitation from an adviser with the institution who went to visit her at her house.  She currently has a business of selling provisions like rice, sugar, and grains, etc.  She learned this business several years ago on her own initiative when she saw that these products are sold a lot in the market.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital to buy provisions that she will get from the wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto.  She will later sell the provisions by order.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services and the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy provisions.

loans.name: Izolat

texts.ru: Изолат трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1955 году. Изолат замужем и имеет 2 детей. Ее муж водитель. Изолат более 10 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она занимается купле продажей женской обуви. Она покупает товар оптом и реализует в розницу на местном рынке. Изолат с бизнесом справляется сама. Она планирует расширить ассортимент своего товара на новый сезон. Изолат не имеет денег, чтобы купить товар на новый сезон. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Izolat is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1955. Izolat is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. Izolat has more than ten years of business experience. She buys and sells women's shoes. She buys goods wholesale and sells them in the local market. Izolat runs the business by herself. She plans to expand her product range for the new season. Izolat has no money to buy inventory for the new season. She is requesting a loan of 1500 somoni. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy shoes for sale.

loans.name: Rukwa Group

texts.en:
Paulo, who is his early 30s, is single with a boy and a girl who are in school. Since 2010, Paulo has been managing his business selling home products like pots, plates, saucepans, and cooking dishes. He starts working from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make very good monthly returns. 

This will be his ninth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Paulo used his previous loans to buy new and out-of-stock business products. He has paid back all his previous loans in full. Paulo is a hardworking man with a good future plan. Paulo usually uses his business profit to cover school fees and home food expenses for his family. He has managed to build a house and bought a bicycle, TV, DVD, and sofa set. He will use this loan to buy business stock to resell. Paulo dreams to be an international businessperson. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Rukwa," which consists of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business stock to resell.

loans.name: Fatena

texts.en:
Fatena is a 37-year-old, married woman from Jericho city. She is a mother, with one son and four daughters. All of them are under 18 years of age. Fatena's husband works as an employee in the public sector, with a low income. 

For the past four years, Fatena has operated a beauty salon in her house to help her husband with part of the family's expenses. She would like to improve her business and maybe, in the future, open her own salon. 

Fatena took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help Fatena to develop her beauty salon by paying for beauty products she uses in her daily work. By taking this loan, Fatena will be able to improve her salon and also her income.

Fatena appears in the photo.

loans.use: to develop her beauty salon by paying for beauty products she uses in her daily work.

loans.name: Mercurio

texts.en:
This is Mercurio, 53, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Lilibeth, a worker abroad, and they have children. He and his wife manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Mercurio operates an LPG business. What he does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers and sell them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size tanks. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy more stocks of LPG tanks to expand his product inventory.

Mercurio dreams that his business will continue to flourish and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more LPG tanks to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Corella, Bohol. Mary Grace earns a living through her firewood and charcoal business. She has been in the business for more than three years now. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Mary Grace is asking for a loan to buy more firewood and charcoal. Mary Grace hopes to make her business a success someday.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
Thun is a mother of five children. Her residential area is Takeo Province, where she does her agribusiness, rice farming. She has been involved in her current business for ages, and it has returned her almost US $9 per day.  

This is the first loan for Thun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking an education loan to cover the tuition fee for her son, who wants to continue his bachelor’s degree program, majoring in finance and banking. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to cover the tuition fee for her son.

loans.name: Anaclet

texts.en:
Anaclet is 55 years old. He is married and has six children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production.  With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and supports labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Urim

texts.en:
Urim is a 47-year-old married father of three children. Urim, whose name in English means “Blessing”, has been in the agriculture business for almost ten years. Planting and harvesting onions has been a seasonal activity for him. In addition, he has apple and cherry orchards. He sells these fruits to villagers, who then sell them from their booths to travelers along the national road that crosses their village. Urim is also a talented man who practices the craft of stone carving and sells such items to locals. 

This will be his first time requesting a loan and he wants to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Petro

texts.en:
Petro lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Petro is married and has nine children and many grandchildren. He has retired from his job as a union labourer, while his wife is engaged in selling cereals. He has been farming for 50 years, and is currently growing maize, millet, beans, lentils, sunflower, and amaranth, as well as raising dairy goats and local cattle. Petro thinks that beekeeping is a good business as “it is not a tiresome activity.”

This is Petro’s first loan, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to pay school fees for his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Shamshad is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of cloths for many years. She purchases variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. Shamshad requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season.

loans.name: Dianna

texts.en:
Dianna lives in Kurtan village with her husband, mother-in-law and two school-age children. The family has been engaged in agriculture for many years. Their farm is small but very beautiful. It includes cows, calves, pig and chickens as well as arable land where Dianna cultivates wheat, potatoes and grass for animals.

The whole family works hard to gather a good agricultural harvest and have a successful farm. By applying for this loan, Dianna would like to purchase two more cows and enlarge her livestock. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Dianna was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan is a hope for this family and they will be very grateful to lenders' for support.

loans.use: to pay for two cows

loans.name: Irodai

texts.ru: Иродаи весела и жизнерадостная девушка из Вахдата. Она замужем. Ей 23 года. Иродаи умелица и мастерица. Она умеет шить национальные женские платья. Ей любит проводить время рядом со швейной машинкой. Она нравится шить и создавать платья своими руками. Иродаи умная девушка и решила использовать свой талант на деле. Она совместит приятное с полезным. Иродаи хочет предоставлять услуги на шитье национальных женских платьев. Для начала Иродаи хочет купить швейную машинку, но из-за того что у нее мало средств она решила взять кредит. На сумму кредита она купит современную компьютерную машину и приступ к работе. Она надеется, что она быстро найдет клиентов и начнет зарабатывать.
texts.en: Irodai is a fun-loving, cheerful girl from Vahdat. She is married. She is 23. Irodai is a talented craftswoman. She knows how to sew traditional dresses. She likes to spend time with her sewing machine. She likes to sew and create dresses with their own hands. Irodai is an intelligent girl who decided to use her talent in business. She will combine business with pleasure. Irodai wants sew traditional dresses. To begin, Irodai wants to buy a sewing machine, but since she has little money, she decided to take out a loan. With the loan, she will buy a modern computerized sewing and get to work. She hopes that she will quickly find clients and start earning money.

loans.use: buy a computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали 27 лет. Он живет вместе со своей женой и двумя детьми в Дангаре. Муродали отец трехлетней дочки и трехмесячного сына. Его жена нигде не работает она сидит дома и присматривает за детьми. Муродали занимается земледелием. Он на своей земле выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Сейчас Муродали хочет посадить пщеницу, но чтобы купить семена и необходимые средства для посева у него не хватает денег и он решил обратиться за кредитом. Муродали верит и надеется, что ему помогут, и он получит богатый урожай.
texts.en: Murodali is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Dangara. Murodali is the father of three daughters and a three-year-old son. His wife does not work, but stays at home looking after the children. Murodali farms. He has his own land to grow crops. Murodali wants to plant wheat, but he does not have enough money to buy seed, so he decided to apply for a loan. Murodali believes and hopes that you will help him and he will get a rich harvest.

loans.use: buy seeds to sow.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Алишеру 30 лет. Он из Спитаменского района. И женатый мужчина. Алишер любит свою семью и старается, чтоб члены его семьи не в чем не нуждались. 
Алишер берет заказы на съемки свадеб и мероприятий. Но из-за того, что заказов мало и в Спитамене свадьбы в основном отмечают в теплый сезон года, доходность от такой работы соответственно мало. Теперь Алишер хочет начать собственный бизнес по откорму и продаже животных. Чтобы начать бизнес ему необходимо собрать нужную сумму денег и купить необходимое количество скотов. Но к сожалению ему не хватает $1500, чтобы начать бизнес и он решился обратиться за кредитом. Алишер верит и надеется на Вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Alisher is thirty years old. He's from Spitamen. He is a married man. Alisher loves his family and tries to ensure they need for nothing. 

Alisher is a videographer for weddings and events. But because there is not a lot of business and most weddings in Spitamen are in the summer, he makes very little from the work. Alisher now wants to start his own business fattening and selling animals. To start the business, he needs to get enough money to buy the cattle. Unfortunately he lacks the $1,500 needed to start a business so he decided to apply for a loan. Alisher believes in and hopes for your help and support.

loans.use: buy cattle to start a livestock fattening business.

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Najat is a 33-year-old married woman from Jericho city. She is a mother with nine kids: five sons and four daughters. All of her children are under 18 years old. Najat's husband works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. Three years ago, Najat opened a beauty salon in her house to help her husband with part of the family expenses. She would like to improve her business and maybe in the future, open her own salon. 

Najat took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to develop her beauty salon by buying beauty products that she uses in her daily work. By taking this loan, Najat will be able to improve her salon and her income.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is from Ozamiz City, Misamis Ocidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She  is 45 years old and is married with four children, all of whom are school-aged. 

In 2010, she applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, she asked for financial assistance of 50,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] to buy additional raw ingredients for her food-vending business. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Johaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Johaida works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline. Johaida is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Johaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Hoima Uganda. She is married and has responsibility for taking care of one child. She has a salon dealing in hair plaiting and styling, and training people in hair plaiting. She also sells cosmetics. She got her initial capital from the sale of her land. The high cost of transport to Kampala for purchases hinder her business. She desires to expand her business. She desires to own a new personal car. She is acquiring a loan to buy cosmetics for resale and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale and to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Fernando Lenin

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 29 años de edad de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos vive los padres en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Fernando se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para los insumos que necesita para la agricultura como  abono, insecticida,  fertilizantes, urea, fungicida además alimento para los animales balanceados. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. El sueño es comprar un terreno. El desafío al que se enfrenta es trabajar mucho más. En su tiempo libre le gusta viajar con su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is 29 years old.  He is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in the Mina de Piedra area of Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  In his free time he likes to travel with his family.

He belongs to the 30th of November communal bank, located in the Mina de Piedra area, Ventanas canton.  The people there work in agricultural and ranching work.

Fernando works in agriculture, sowing corn and raising barnyard animals such as chickens and pigs.  He is asking for a loan for necessary supplies such as soil amendments, insecticide, fertilizers, urea, and fungicides, as well as balanced feed for the animals.  He’ll make the purchases in Ventanas.  His dream is to buy a plot of land.  A challenge that he faces is working a lot more.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 сыновей. Старший сын работает разнорабочим в России и высылает часть зарплаты родителям в Кыргызстан, а младший сын проживает с родителями. Супруг и младший сын помогают по хозяйству. У Токтокан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Токтокан занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Токтокан , в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 бычок, 40 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Токтокан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Toktokan is 54 years old, married, and raising two sons with her husband. The eldest son is working as a laborer in Russia. He sends part of his salary to his parents in Kyrgyzstan. The youngest son lives with his parents. Her husband and youngest son help with the farm work. Toktokan has a secondary education. The family's primary source of income is animal husbandry. Toktokan started this 16 years ago when she bought cattle with 20,000 KGS. Because of Toktokan's hard work, today her farm boasts two dairy cows, one horse, one bull, and forty sheep. Her monthly income is 5,000 KGS. In order to further expand her farm, Toktokan approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase cows for breeding. Toktokan plans to invest profits from the loan into further expanding her domestic animals, and plans to save enough money to further her children's education.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives and works in Sindo, outside of Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Charles is married, and has seven children. Charles farms and also runs a grinding mill that turns raw grain into flour. He has been farming for 15 years, and is currently growing maize, amaranth, and beans, as well as keeping cattle and dairy goats. Charles likes beekeeping because it encourages tree planting, and thus environmental conservation. 

This is Charles’ first loan, and he plans to use the income from his hives to pay school fees for his children, to expand his grinding mill business and to pay for basic family needs. His hope for the future is to have a better life and to fully feed his healthy family.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Uma is 32 years old. She is married and has one son. She is from the rural area, Maynaguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a housewife and studied up to higher secondary standard (grade 12). Her husband, Baban, has education up to class IX (grade 9). Their only son is in class III (grade 3). They live in their own small semi-pakka house (brick walls and straw roof).

Uma's husband is a photographer, and does video recording and prepares video cassettes. They have a business of video recording. Uma assists her husband in his work. 

Now her husband wants to buy a video camera to extend the business. Uma came to know about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and applied for a loan from them. They want to provide better service to their customers, especially when demand is high. Usually, in marriage ceremony season, the business runs very well. They want to increase her business and earn a better profit.

Their plan is to open a video parlor in the near future, where video cassette recording will be done, and as well different video cassettes will be sold. She also wants to give financial stability to her family and a good education to her son.

Uma appreciates very much the support that BJS and Kiva offered her.

loans.use: to buy a video camera to extend her existing video cassette recording business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Isatu from Waterloo2 in the western rural area of Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 14 and 19 years old. In 2010, Isatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to develop herself and her children. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to change her business to a wax cotton store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Bobonazar

texts.ru: Бобоназару 41 год. Он с женой, сыновьями и матерью живет в районе Носири Хисрав. Бобоназар является фермером. Он арендует 3 га орошаемого участка земли, где занимается посевом пшеницы, лука и кукурузы. Бобоназар занимается данной деятельностью более 6 лет. Сыновья помогают ему в работе на земле. Этой осенью он уже посеял на один 1 га земли пшеницу, на 0,50 га лук и на 0,50 га кукурузу. Бобоназар просит кредит. Он хочет купить топливо и минеральные удобрения, чтобы обработать озимые саженцы. Весной Бобоназар надеется получить хороший урожай и за счет его прибыли женить старшего сына.
texts.en: Bobonazar is 41 years old. He and his wife, sons, and mother live in Nosiri Khusrav. Bobonazar is a farmer. He rents three hectares of irrigated land, where he sows wheat, onions and corn. Bobonazar has been doing this for more than six years. His sons help him farm. This fall, he sowed one hectare of wheat, 0.50 hectares of onions and 0.50 hectares of corn. Bobonazar is asking for a loan. He wants to buy fuel and fertilizer to treat winter seedlings. In the spring Bobonazar hopes to get a good harvest and use the profit to marry off his eldest son.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Umidmurod

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, которого зовут Умидмурод, живет в отдаленном регионе вместе со своей семьей и занимается скотоводством, так как основным источником дохода его района является скотоводство и земледелие. Он не женат. Умидмурод этим бизнесом уже занимается более 3 года. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. У него большой огород, где выращивает сено для скота. Он продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Еще он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: There is a man named Umidmurod who has a huge kind heart and a beautiful soul. He lives in a remote area with his family and is engaged in animal husbandry. The primary source of income in the region is agriculture and animal husbandry. He is not married. Umidmurod has been doing this business for more than three years. The local climate is very favorable for farming and keeping livestock. He has a big garden where he grows hay for cattle. He sells milk to his neighbors and the neighbors are very pleased to receive natural dairy products. He also sells livestock which he first keeps for a few months. At the market, he has a lot of customers. He wants to grow his business, but does not have sufficient means to do so. He is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy cattle to increase his business. He's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy cattle for sale.

loans.name: Samia Madelen

texts.es:
Samia tiene 18 años de edad estado civil soltera, vive con su madre en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Noviembre que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto mina de piedra, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Samia se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas.  Solicita el préstamo para  poder comprar los fertilizantes para la siembra.  Las compras lo realiza en el cantón ventanas.   Su sueño es terminar sus estudios para tener una mejor calidad de  vida. El desafío  que enfrenta es combatir contra la naturaleza.  En su tiempo libre la gusta nadar.
texts.en:
Samia is 18 years old.  She is single, and lives with her mother in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  In her free time she likes to swim.

She is a member of the 30 de Noviembre communal bank, which is located in the Mina de Piedra area of the Ventanas canton.  Its members work in agriculture and livestock.

Samia works sowing corn and raising chickens.  She is asking for this loan to be able to buy fertilizers for her fields.  She makes her purchases in the Ventanas canton.  Her dream is to finish her studies to have a better quality of life.  The challenge she faces is battling against nature.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Jenelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is 59 years old. He is married with three children. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea, age 30, is from the Sagarejo district. She is married with two school age children; she lives with her retired parents. Tea leads the family agricultural business, and breeds cows, whose milk is sold locally.  In addition, Tea has several chickens and sometimes sells eggs from her house.  Tea’s husband serves local people as a taxi driver with his own car and earns daily money. 

Now, Tea is requesting a loan to expand the family agricultural business and buy calves.  Part of the loan will be used for buying feed for cattle. After purchasing livestock, she will raise them and sell them in the fall season for a higher price. It will generate an income, and the new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves and feed for them

loans.name: Kamala

texts.ru: Камале 23 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Камалы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Камала занимается животноводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 70,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Камалы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 теленок, 2 овцы, 3 ягненка, 5 коз, 5 козлят. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Камала обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Камала планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Kamala is 23 years old, married, and has two children with her husband. Kamala has a secondary education. Kamala's livestock business is the primary source of income for the family. She started four years ago when she bought 70,000 KGS worth of livestock. Because of Kamala's hard work, her farm now has two milk cows, one horse, one calf, two sheep, three lambs, five goats, and five kids. Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Kamala turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy sheep for breeding. Kamala plans to invest profits from the loan into expanding her livestock, and she plans to save enough money educate her children.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen is from Saramej village in the Lori region. He lives there with his father, wife and two grown children. Vazgen has been involved in agriculture for 20 years. He keeps piglets, cows, and chickens and cultivates barley, potatoes and cabbage. Vazgen also goes to a neighboring country as a migrant worker in the summer season.
 
Realizing that agribusiness helps him and his family to have a stable income, he would like to enlarge this business. He asks for this loan to be able to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This will greatly help him to continue developing his farm and run it in a sustainable way. As this is Vazgen's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

Vazgen waits for the lenders' support. The loan is very important for him.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru: Абдувохид 50-летний фермер и большую часть своего времени проводит на участке земли. Он имеет 1 га орошаемого участка земли, где занимается посевом пшеницы и овощей. Он занят в этом деле более 3 лет. Вся семья помогает ему в ведении сельского хозяйства. Абдувохиду нравится его земледельческая деятельность, так как он получает с деятельности не только доход, но и обеспечивает семью свежими и экологически чистыми овощами. Абдувохид живет с женой и четырьмя детьми в районе Кубадиён. Параллельно он еще и занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Сейчас Абдувохид проводит посев и в связи с этим нуждается в кредите. Ему необходимо закупить семена пшеницы и минеральные удобрения. Он ждет Вашей поддержки.
texts.en:
Abduvohid is a 50-year-old farmer who spends a great deal of time working his fields. He's been farming for more than 3 years, and currently has a 1-hectare plot of irrigated land where he grows wheat and vegetables. His whole family helps him tend to the farm as well. Abduvohid likes farming as it allows him not only to earn money for his family, but provide them with fresh, ecologically-pure vegetables.

Abduvohid lives with his wife and 4 children in the Qubadiyon region of Tajikistan. Apart from farming, he also works as a taxi driver. At the moment, he is sowing his fields and needs a loan to stock up on wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers. He is counting on your help.

loans.use: buy wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Savoeun (pictured with his son) is 59 years old. He is a widower, and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, his children are working in construction and garment factory. They make an income of $18 daily to help support their family. Due to the difficulty in his family’s transportation, Savoeun asks for a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help him reduce the transportation expenses and help his children to easily commute to work. In the future, he would like to take another loan from KREDIT to fix his house to make it more comfortable for his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат честный молодой человек. Ему 21 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Шавкат данное время является студентом 3 курса Таджикского Технологического Университета. Он учится по специальности инженер программист.  Он поступил в университет в 2010 году и в течение этих лет, он учится хорошо и отлично. Шавкат еще со школьной скамьи мечтал стать программистом и упорно учился. Его семья интеллигентная. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег для этого. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shavkat is an honest, upstanding young man.  He is 21, married, and lives with his parents.  He is currently in his 3rd year at the Technological University of Tajikistan, where he's studying to be a software engineer.  He first enrolled in 2010, and has been getting along well in his studies.  Shavkat comes from a family of educated people, and has wanted to be a programmer since he was in grade school; he's worked diligently and applied himself with hopes of becoming one.  Currently, he needs to pay for his university tuition, and is seeking a loan to do so.  He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: pay his tuition

loans.name: Mackline

texts.en: Mackline is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She has a business selling carrots, eggplant and green peppers and has been in this business for four years.  She works on a wholesale basis six days out of every week at the market. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of green peppers, eggplant and carrots.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and spoilage. She is aspiring to grow some of the vegetables and to educate her children up to university. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest they charge. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy green peppers, eggplant and carrots.

loans.name: Kpannal

texts.en: Kpannal lives at Sinkor in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, which is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 38 year old and married with four children between 13 and 23 years old who attend school. For the past 13 years, she has been running a table market where she sells rice, oil, and slippers. She started this business with money from her friends and learned this way of selling from them. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, oil, and slippers for her business. She wants to get more money to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Sarah from Waterloo2 in the western rural area of Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is single with one child. In 2008, Sarah established her retail business. She began her business because she did not go to school so she was trained in this business. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run a business.

Sarah requires a loan in order to purchase more groundnuts and oranges for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Sarah plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts and oranges for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Isatu from rural Waterloo in western Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with a seventeen-year-old child.

In 1998 Isatu began to sell pharmaceuticals to earn money for her survival. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:30 p.m. seven days a week. Inflation and establishing a proper selling location is her main business challenge.

Isatu is applying for a 1,300,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more pharmaceuticals to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her living standards and increase her business.

Isatu plans to expand her business in the coming years. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more pharmaceuticals to sell.

loans.name: Hijas De Illampu Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HIJAS DEL ILLAMPU” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Soledad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, tejido de mantas, costura de blusas, venta de queso, venta de comida, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Soledad es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que visitó su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapa (comida tradicional); da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de hace varios años al observar la necesidad de la clientela de contar con un espacio de comida.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que se realizan en el grupo.

En la fotografía no se encuantra una señora, ya que se fue a recoger a su hijo de la guardería.
texts.en:
The “HIJAS DEL ILLAMPU” communal bank will begin its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Achacachi center. It is made up of eight members and is led by Soledad, who is the president. The businesses that the members of the association have are varied. Among them are: selling fish, weaving blankets, sewing blouses, selling cheese, selling food and selling fruit.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Soledad. She says that this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a counselor from the institution that visited her house. Right now, she has a business selling salchipapa (a traditional food). She says that she learned this business several years ago when she saw the need the customers had to have a place that sold food. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying potatoes and meat wholesale. She will acquire it from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz. After preparing the food, she will sell it in her sales space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has a son.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings that the group does. 

One woman is missing from the photograph because she went to pick up her son at daycare.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and meat wholesale.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en: Gela is a 32-year-old married man. He lives in a small village in Telavi district with his wife, son, brother and his family. The only source of income for his family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard. Gela does all the agricultural work to harvest good grapes. He produces wine and vodka, which is sold locally. Gela has a truck and has decided to start an additional business using his truck. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,400 GEL to install gas in his truck and also to remake the truck as a pickup. He will load wood on it and transport it from the forest to sell. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to remake his truck as a pickup and to transport wood from the forest to sell

loans.name: Allah  Raki

texts.en: Allah Raki is a 41-year-old, vigorous lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people in her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. Allah Raki intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colours along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. These will help her to stitch up more dresses in less time, and to generate a healthier source of income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colours along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos y esposa en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la venta de panca en su motokar, su esposa organiza la panca y Nicolás lo distribuye por su distrito.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para adquirir en mayor cantidad panca y así poder distribuirlo por las zonas aledañas a su distrito, generando ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 52 year old and lives with his wife and children in the Oyotun district, a community where the people are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.
 
He and his wife sell corn husks out of their car.  His wife sets it up and Nicolas delivers it throughout his district.

He is asking for a loan of 1,000 Nuevo Soles to buy husks in quantity so he can deliver to the surrounding zones in the district, generating additional income for the family.

loans.use: to buy corn husks.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de maestro de construcción tanto en su distrito como en zonas aledañas a su comunidad, es conocido por el buen servicio que ofrece, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de madera que es una herramienta de trabajo para armar las columnas y de esta manera seguir brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes y la mismo tiempo ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando is 41 years old and lives in the Cayaltí district, a community where the people work as farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides construction services in his community and the surrounding areas and is known for his good service.  He is asking for a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy lumber and tools to put together some columns and provide better service to his customers, while increasing his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lumber and tools.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.es: Cristy, de 22 años de edad, es una señorita trabajadora, empeñosa y muy decidida. Es soltera. Vive junto a sus padres luchando por salir adelante. La actividad que realiza Cristy es la venta de comidas de la región. Su trabajo actualmente se inicia desde muy temprano en un local que alquila en una zona comercial muy concurrida por el público. Anteriormente vendía en el frontis de su vivienda, pero gracias a la demanda que tienen sus potajes decidió establecer un pequeño restaurante e ir tras el camino del progreso. Realiza esta labor desde hace 02 años con ayuda de su hermana. Le gusta su actividad porque gracias a ello puede generar el dinero necesario que usa para apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente los ingredientes necesarios que usa para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, plátanos, menestras, carnes y pescados.
texts.en:
Cristy, 22, is a hardworking, enterprising and very dedicated young woman. She lives with her parents, striving to get ahead. The activity that Cristy does is selling food of the region. Currently, she starts her work from very early in a place she rents in a commercial zone that is very frequented by the public. In the past, she sold from the front room of her home, but thanks to the demand of her stews she decided to establish a small restaurant and go upon the path of success.

She has been doing this labor for the past 2 years with help of her sister. She likes this activity because thanks to it, she can generate the necessary money that she uses to support her mother with the expenses of the home. On this occasion, she is applying for 1500 S. She is very content knowing that has an economic backup to continue advancing with the fulfillment of her goals. 

With the amount requested, she will progressively buy the necessary ingredients that she uses for the preparation of her foods like to buy ingredients such as rice, plantains, dried vegetables, meats and fish.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, plantains, dried vegetables, meats and fish.

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three East African countries, allowing cross-border flow of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. 

Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Enos is married, and has seven children. He used to work as a salesman, but lost his job in the post-election violence of 2007/2008, and now he focuses on his farming. He has been farming for five years, and is currently growing maize, sunflowers and millet, as well as raising goats. Enos thinks that beekeeping is a good business because honey is medicinal, provides income, and his bees will help pollinate his crops. 

This is Enos’ first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income to educate his children and expand his farming activities. When asked if he had a message for Kiva lenders, he said, “Thank them. They are going to change our lives.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She deals in business by selling clothes in her community. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colours and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Rani is requesting a loan of 25,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colours and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her forth loan cycle and has good credit history. Rani is hopeful that she will increase her income and plans to spend part of the profits on providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colours and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Doña Petronila es una señora muy trabajadora ama de casa y agricultora, casada siendo su esposo agricultor que de su matrimonio procrearon 4 hijos quienes son jóvenes luchadores igual que sus padres dedicados al trabajo de campo. Tiene un grado de estudio primario incompleto el cual curso hasta el 4 grado ya que su familia de escasos recursos no pudo apoyarla. Desde muy temprana edad por vocación familiar aprendió a trabajar la tierra siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran el cultivo de granos básicos como la siembra de maíz, frijol y café. En compañía de su hoy en día esposo desde hace más de 20 años trabajan la tierra siendo este rubro el factor principal de su economía familiar siendo sus clientes las bodegas de las diferentes zonas aledañas a su comunidad actividad en la cual solo ellos como familia se involucran.
Sus planes para el futuro plantar una buena parcela de tierra con café ya que es una producto que a pesar de las   varianzas de precio en el mercado no deja de ser popular y buscado por sus diferentes compradores como también hacerle mejoras a su vivienda. Por lo que ella hoy en día ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los cuales dará asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de maíz y frijol ya que de esta manera ella protegerá su producción y obtendrá una buena ganancia.
texts.en:
Petronila is a hardworking housewife and farmer.  She is married and her husband is a farmer.  They have four children who are young hard workers in the fields like their parents.  She has an incomplete elementary school education.  She only completed fourth grade because her parents were not able to continue supporting her, but she learned the family vocation from a young age.  Her parents taught her to raise basic grains such as corn, beans, and coffee.  She and her husband have been working the fields for 20 years and this is the family’s main source of income.  Her customers are the stores in different areas around her community.  This is the only activity that the family works in.

Her future plans include planting coffee on a good parcel of land, since coffee is a good product that does not cease to be popular, despite its market price and is sought after by her buyers.  She also wants to make improvements to her home.  She is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies that will help maintain her corn and bean crops, since this will protect her production so that she can have good earnings.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael, 51 years old, is married to a teacher and they have five children. Since he doesn't have any work now, he is in charge of cultivating his two-hectare rice field.

Rafael is a loving husband and father. Everyday he wakes up early in the morning to prepare breakfast. With the two hectares of rice field he cultivates, he is in need of more capital. So, he is asking for a loan of  PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticides and insecticides to maintain his farm. Rafael hopes someday that his business will expand so that he can provide all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as hardworking. He operates a farm where he grows crops. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his family's challenge to be a lack of enough water for domestic use. He will use this 38,000 KES loan to buy a water tank for storing clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful in farming. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Jackson's previous loan of 60,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for storing clean water.

loans.name: Derli Estefania

texts.es:
Derli tiene 21 años de edad es soltera tiene una hija, vive con los padres vive en en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios. 

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias. 

Derli se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz suave. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves. Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquirir algunos insumos.

El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas. La meta es tener dinero para dar lo necesario a la hija. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver television y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Derli is 21 years old; she is single; she has a daughter; and she lives with her parents.  She lives in Mocache Canton, which is part the Los Rios Province.

Her communal bank is called 27 de Octubre and it is located in the precinct of Sara Guerrero, which is part of the canton of Mocache.  It deals with farming and livestock.

Derli works in farming, growing yellow corn.  She does her buying in Mocache at the Thursday market.  WIth the money, she has been able to cover some necessities, such as labor costs and getting some supplies. 

She requested this loan to buy fertilizers, manure, and seed.  Her goal is to have money to provide her daughter with what she needs.  In her free time, she likes to watch television and play sports.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and seed

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
