Esther lives in Sinkor on the outskirts of Monrovia, the capital city and commercial center of Liberia. She is 32 year old and lives together with her fiancée who is a local businessman. They have two children, ten and sixteen years old; both go to school and live at home.

Over the past two years Esther has sold cooking oil at a table in the market. Her fiancée taught her how to sell. Besides making money, she likes working there as she enjoys being around other vendors and customers.

Esther is applying for a 30,000 LRD loan through BRAC Liberia to buy extra cooking oil to sell. She wants to save more money so she can build her family a house.

loans.use: to buy extra cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen bought her stock in bulk using her previous loan. This helped her to save on transport costs and she was also able to buy cheaply which enabled her to get increased profits.The output helped her to begin construction on the family residential house for her children. She now wants another loan to increase her working capital and buy food items for selling in bulk, this being a harvest season. Doreen is very hard working.

loans.use: to buy food items for selling.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTA ROSA” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Emma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de blusas y ropa interior, servicio de albañil, venta de golosinas, tienda de comida, servicio de construcción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Emma es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña, al apoyar a su familia en el negocio familiar, posteriormente decide emprender su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración  lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “SANTA ROSA” communal bank will begin its fifth cycle Pro Mujer as a part of the Alto Lima center. It is made up of  nine members and is led by Emma, who is the president. The businesses that the members of the association have are varied. Among them are: selling blankets, selling blouses and underwear, bricklaying, selling candies, selling food, and construction service. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Emma. She says that this is the second year that she has been in Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a friend, who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has a workshop where she sews jackets. She says that she learned this business as a child while helping in the family business. Later, she decided to open her own work space. 
 
The loan she will take out now is is to increase capital by buying fabric. She will acquire it from wholesalers from the city of La Paz. After making the jackets, she will sell them in her sales space. This work helps her generate resources for her family, since she  is single and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the loans and the health information.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a 52-year-old married father of six children who has been working in the construction business for 36 years. Hamza specializes in painting and decoration work. He is very talented in his domain, and recommended by all of his customers. 

Hamza was only 16 years old when he started working in this domain. 

He is his family's sole breadwinner, that's why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary construction tools that he needs to finish a certain project he is working on.

He is working hard to establish a construction company where he can provide all construction services to his customers.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction tools that he needs to finish a certain project he is working on

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has two children aged four years and seven years. She describes herself as strong and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of clothes. She will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy clothing stock. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big boutique. This is her first loan with SMEP. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy clothing stock

loans.name: Sabeera

texts.en:
Sabeera, age 57, is a married woman and the mother of five children. She is involved in a business manufacturing shoe uppers with the support of her son, who is also shown in the photo. They supply these uppers to different factories, where these are used in making shoes, and make a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.  

Currently, Sabeera has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation for further improvement of her business. With the loan investment, she will buy leather, along with spools of thread. That will allow her to make shoe uppers in larger quantities. 

She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy leather, along with spools of thread.

loans.name: Raheem

texts.en: Raheem, aged 42, is a married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them on the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She also sells milk to generate an extra income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Raheem has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar is a 34-year-old married lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colours along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time and generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle and has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colours along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa's goal in life is to send and let her children finish their studies. She doesn’t have any money to give them when they will be separated, but the only treasure she can give to them is education. Jesusa runs a sari-sari (variety) store business and at the same time is a vendor of vegetables in the market. She can do two businesses at once, because she wants to attain her goal.

Jesusa now is requesting for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy vegetables and grocery items to sell. She wants to have additional capital to extend the products she offers. Jesusa’s earnings will be utilized by her children's needs, most especially in their chosen profession. She would be grateful if her requested loan will be granted,.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Katnaghbyur Village in Aragatsotn region. She lives with her husband and together they have been involved in agriculture. They keep chickens, cows and calves as well as cultivate grass which they use as forage. Aida also owns an orchard where she grows apricots, apples, pears and nut trees. The couple sells the gathered harvest to local resellers and earns an income for living. 

Aida has now applied for this loan to enlarge her farm. She plans to use the loan for purchasing forage for feeding the livestock, a pig and five piglets. As this is Aida's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

This loan will greatly assist Aida and her husband and enlarge their agribusiness and improve their farm. They will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock, a pig and five piglets.

loans.name: Abaticumugambi Cb Group

texts.en: Abaticumugambi is a group loan led by Claudine. Claudine is married with two children. Abaticumugambi is composed of different members selling different items who are very keen to make a change in their lives and the community. In English, the name "Abaticumugambi" means "keep up the promise". As a leader, Claudine sells clothes and has been in the business for the past six years. The profits from her business will be used to make more savings. Claudine is on the back row and has put up her hand as an identification for other group members.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane and her husband manage a canteen in front of the university within their town. She offers a variety of meals, snacks and drinks. She also manages an Internet café. Mary Jane's goal is to satisfy her customers and be sure they are happy with her services.

For her to meet her goals, Mary Jane is applying for a 25,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy drinks, snack foods and ingredients such as meat to make her meals and snacks to sell. She believes that by availing herself of this loan, she will be able to raise her income and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods and ingredients such as meat to make her meals and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Kortoy

texts.en:
Kortoy, who lives in Sinkor, is 40 years old and single with three children between 11 and 18 years of age. All of her children are in school and live at home. 

For the past three years Kortoy has been selling charcoal in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending ten hours on her business. She started this business with money given to her by her children’s father, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business; her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Alaxpaqcha Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALAXPACHA II” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, productos YAMBAL, venta de tucumanas, costura de sombreros, tejido de chompas, venta de deportivos, costura de chamarras, venta de café.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tucumanas (comida boliviana); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años, al observar que este producto se vendía con amplia cobertura en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa, aceite, verduras) que adquirirá de las tiendas ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que realizan en los grupos.
texts.en:
The “ALAXPACHA II” communal bank will start its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the German Busch center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Juana is the president. The businesses that the members of the association have are varied. Among them are sewing jackets, YAMBAL products, selling tucumanas, sewing hats, knitting sweaters, selling sports clothing, sewing jackets, selling coffee. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Juana. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three cycles. She joined at the invitation of a member of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling tucumanas (Boliviana food). She says that she she started this business on her own initiative several years ago when she saw that this product sold well in the market. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying potatoes, oil, and vegetables. She will acquire them from stores in the markets of the city of El Alto. After making her product, she will sell them in her sales space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is in a common law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings that they do in groups.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, oil and vegetables.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is a 42-year-old married woman; she deals in a business selling cloths in her community to earn income to bear her household expenditures. 

She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Faiza is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

Faiza expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Sayat Nova village. She lives there with her husband, retired parents-in-law and 20-year-old daughter. 

Anahit and her husband run a small but beautiful farm. They keep chickens, pigs and a cow. They also own a greenhouse where they cultivate greens. Unfortunately the greenhouse is too old and needs to be renovated, but Anahit has not saved money for that. 

Anahit has applied for this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. The loan will greatly assist Anahit to bring the farm to working conditions and enlarge the cultivation of greens. Anahit has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Anahit was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan is a hope for Anahit to continue his agribusiness and she relies on lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu lives at Sinkor in Montserrado County the capital city of Liberia, known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is a 45 year old married woman with 4 children between the ages of 11 and 30. Only one of her children is attending school, and lives at home. 

For the past five years now Musu has been running  a market table where she sells door locks, nails, hinges, and others items. She started this business with the help from her father and learned this way of selling from him. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and make her popular, she is requesting a loan to buy more door locks, nails, hinges, and others items for her business. She want to get more money to build her house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more door locks, nails, hinges, and others items for her business.

loans.name: Narek

texts.en: Narek is from Hovtashen village which is in Ararat region. He studies at Yerevan State Conservatory after Komitas in the vocal department. He lives with his parents and grandmother in the village and the university is located in Yerevan town. It is difficult for his family to cover every day costs and at the same time pay for university tuition. So Narek has applied for this loan to pay for his education and continue his studies. Narek dreams of becoming a well-known singer and does his best to achieve his goal. He hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Blanca Maritza

texts.es:
Blanca de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta  6°grado de educación básica, se dedica al negocio de gas propano des de hace año y medio,  su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura, de cuatro hijos que como pareja tienen solo tres viven con ellos; una ya esta acompañada,  los tres solteros están en la escuela y dependen en su totalidad de los padres.


Blanca el negocio que realiza es el de vender gas propano. Algo que lo hace un poco tiempo mediante un acuerdo con el ministerio de Economía, la cliente vende un promedio de 40 tambos semanales. Antes de tener este negocio se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos,  pues el gas lo distribuye solo en la comunidad y lo entrega a domicilio lo traslada un hijo en una bicicleta sin importar la hora y el día que sea. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar más chimbos de gas, ya que en los últimos días no le ajusta y pierde de vender y por ende ganar dinero  y con ellos estará satisfaciendo la desventaja de no tener gas en existencia. 

En el futuro Blanca, espera mejorar el negocio y no perder de vista que sus hijos no dejen de estudiar y ver a sus hijos trabajar en una institución y no dejara de luchar hasta que lo logre .
texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Blanca has a sixth-grade primary education.  She has worked at her propane gas business for a year and half.  Her life partner works in farming.  Of their four children, only three live with them; one daughter is already in a relationship, while the three single ones are on school and are totally dependent on their parents. 

Blanca's business is selling propane gas.  She has done this for a short time through an agreement with the Ministry of Economy.  She sells an average of 40 tanks per week.  Before having this business she did housework for a living.  She only distributes the gas within the community and she offers home delivery; her son transports it on a bicycle no matter what time or day it is.

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy more tanks, as she hasn't had enough lately and she is losing sales and money and with the tanks she will make up for her losses from not having gas on hand.

In the future Blanca hopes to improve her business and make sure that her children stay in school so she can see them get work at institutions and she will not stop working until it happens.

loans.use: to buy tanks of gas

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with four children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for ten years. 

Fatuma has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, hair oil, weaves and braids. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. 

Fatuma is aspiring to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, hair oil, weaves and braids

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 39-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one cow which she uses for selling milk to the local people. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Sughran has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This loan will allow her to purchase an additional cow. Sughran is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Zinat

texts.en:
Zinat is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has run a beauty parlor for about four years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. 

Due to her great service, she has become very well-known on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a larger variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. Because she has a low amount of cash, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for her eighth loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. 

Zinat is hopeful that she can cater to more customers in time. She expects a boost in her earnings due to her loan, and she plans to spend a part of her profits on her family.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, who assists her by purchasing stock from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Jana

texts.en: Jana is 43 a year old married woman, from village Bugeuli. She lives with her husband and school-aged daughter. Jana's husband is a builder, has private orders and generates 450 GEL per month. Jana wants to have her own income and to be involved in agricultural activity. Jana has 2 applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of a Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of 1900 $ will help her to be financially independent, purchase eggs, maize, medicines and a heater for her poultry farm. When the chickens will be grown, she will sell them at a good price. The family will get a significant source of income from this activity. Jana awaits your support.

loans.use: to set up a poultry farm.

loans.name: Elichka

texts.en:
Elichka is from Kapan. She lives with her husband, two grown up daughters and is a musical teacher at local music school. Elichka has been also involved in agriculture. She keeps 8 sheep. As it has been only a year that Elichka has been keeping sheep, her barn is in very poor condition and needs to be renovated. She has applied for this loan to be able to renovate her barn and also to purchase 8 more sheep. She is sure that enlarging her livestock will give her an opportunity to increase the income from her agribusiness.

Elichka has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back on time. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Elichka was able to ensure that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Elichka and her family hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn and purchase 8 sheep.

loans.name: Francisco Ruben

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 38 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos vive en en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios. 

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias. 

Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y crianza de pollos. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves. Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquirir algunos insumos. Enfrenta desafios como el clima.

El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas liquidos para la maleza. La meta es tener dinero para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Francisco is 38 years old, in a relationship, and has three children.  He lives with his partner and their children in Mocache Canton, which is part of the province of Los Rios.

His communal bank is called 27 de Octubre.  It is located in the precinct of Sara Guerrero, which is part of Mocache Canton.  It deals with farming and livestock. 

Francisco works in farming, growing corn, and raises chickens.  He does his buying in Mocache at the Thursday market.  With the money he has been able to cover some necessities, such as labor costs and getting some supplies.  He faces challenges, such as the weather. 

He requested this loan to buy fertilizers, manure, seed, and weed killers.  His goal is to have money to keep investing in his business.  In his free time he likes to play sports with his friends from the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seed, and weed killers

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en: Kebbeh lives in Montserrado County the capital city of Liberia, it is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is a 45 year old married woman with 4 children, aged between 7 and 25, who are in school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling slipper potatoes greens in the local market. She started this business with the help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends 8 hours each day with her business and she uses taxis most of the time to get her goods to her table. She likes her business because it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more potato greens to expand her sales. She wants to get more money to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and greens to expand her sales.

loans.name: Kalsoum

texts.en:
Kalsoum is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been selling cloth to pay for her household expenses. She buys different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Kalsoum is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend the part of her profits on her family.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en: Kausar is a 40-year-old, married woman and the mother of six children. She has been weaving sweaters and caps for the past 10 years. She works hard on her weaving every day so she may earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education. Kausar is requesting her fifth loan from Kashf Foundation of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors along with packets of needles. With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors along with packets of needles.

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik lives in Kadjaran in Syunik region. He is married and has three daughters. Two daughters are married and live separately with their families. The youngest one lives with her parents. Rubik’s wife works at a laboratory as an assistant. For more than 20 years, Rubik has had a garage of his own, where he repairs cars. He also has a car of his own, which he drives to special markets, and from there buys tools for his repair activities. 

Rubik needs a loan in the amount of 1,100,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a machine for dismantling car tires, since he does it very often while repairing cars.

loans.use: to buy a machine for dismantling car tires, since he does it very often while repairing cars

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County where living conditions are almost like the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as a well laid out place in Liberia. She is 28 years old, unmarried, with four children between 11 months old and 8 years old. Only three of her children are in school and they all live at home. For seven years she has been selling fish in the community market. She started this business with the help of her fiance who works as a businessman, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish to expand her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to expand her sales

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is a taxi driver. He has been married for eight years and has two children. His son's age is seven, and in this year, he goes to first class of school. Elshan's daughter goes to kindergarten. His wife is a housewife. They live in Absheron region. It’s noted that Elshan is a taxi driver. He has been in this business for nine years, and during these years his car became outdated. 

Today Elshan wants to repair his car. For this reason, he has applied for a loan in amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Elshan is thankful to Kiva organization and it's lenders for the help. In the future, he wants to change his car, increase his business, and give a good future to his children.

loans.use: to repair his car (taxi).

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en: Truphena is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be self-motivated and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells curtains. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough money. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of curtains. Her business goal is to own a bigger business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to add stock of curtains for resale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a single mother of two children and all her children go to school. She has a business selling used shoes and has been in this business for five years. 

Aisha has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She works at the market five days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Aisha is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en: Hadija is a married lady with three children hailing from a rural area in Sanga Nyabushozi District. Unfortunately, her husband died in the war as he was a soldier. She operates a business dealing in household items and it’s where she earns income for a living and survival for the whole family. She even managed to save some money and constructed a house and she is requesting a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to complete the house.

loans.use: To  buy construction materials to complete her residential house

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past six years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons, to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is a 49-year-old married man living in the capital city suburb with his wife and grown son. The only one who earns money in the household is Zviad’s wife, who is a nurse at the local hospital in return for a small monthly salary. The existing income is modest and hardly enough to cover high utilities and feeding expenses. Zviad owns a car and plans to use it as a taxi and start a business, but he needs money to change his car’s fuel system. 

His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and MFO, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. This loan will help Zviad to pay for changing his car's fuel system from petrol to natural gas, which is cheaper than petrol and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent. This will allow Zviad to offer cheap services to his customers and attract them. With this Startup loan, Zviad will start a taxi business and generate income for covering food and everyday expenses. The increased income will be used for his family's well being.

loans.use: to change the fuel system of his car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en: Shanaz is a 45-year-old married woman doing business selling milk for the past 6 years. She has one buffalo and two cows for her milk business. She sells milk to many of her neighbors along with the butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. She is a mother of seven children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support from it. Now she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Guhlam  Sakina

texts.en:
Guhlam Sakina is a 37-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of selling and purchasing animals for many years. She buys animals, such as baby goats and calves, at low prices, brings them up and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries).  She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.  

Currently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. She lives with her son’s family. Gayane has her own business: production of lemonade. She can surely say that her family lives on her business income.  

She organizes it in a small workshop close to their house. She has been in this business for ten years and she is already rather skilled in it. Her son helps her greatly in her business and in his own car he distributes lemonades to the food markets and restaurants of their region of Lori. 

Gayane asks a loan of 500,000 AMD since she wants to buy some raw materials for her lemonade production and also to be ready to accept a lot of orders from her partners before New Year.

loans.use: to buy some raw materials for her lemonade production and also to be ready to accept a lot of orders from her partners

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru: Мухаммаджону из района Спитамена 29 лет. Он женат. Мухаммаджон с женой и родителями живут в одном доме. Отец Мухаммаджона работает сторожем, а мама продавщица и работает на центральном рынке района. Мухаммаджон работает таксистом. На данный момент такая деятельность является основной, но не постоянной. Мухаммаджон решил начать собственный бизнес животноводства. Он хочет выращивать крупно рогатых скотов у себя дома. Для начала нового бизнеса Мухаммадчон подготовился хорошо. У него имеется коровник (он стоит рядом с коровником) и корм для скота. Но нет достаточной суммы денег для приобретения скота. Мухаммаджон решил взять кредит. На сумму от кредита Мухаммаджон намерен приобрести двух крупно рогатых скотов и начать свой бизнес.
texts.en: Muhammadjon has lived in the Spitamen district for 29 years. He is married and lives with his wife and his parents. His father works as a custodian and his mother is a saleswoman at the central market. Muhammadjon is a taxi driver. This is currently his only job, but the work is not consistent. He decided to start his own livestock business and wants to raise cattle at home. He is well prepared to start a business. He has a barn (he is standing next to it in the photo) and cattle feed, but he does not have enough money to buy cattle. He decided to take out a loan to buy two cows and start his business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and start a new livestock business

loans.name: 18 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “18 DE MAYO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Raquel es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de refrescos, venta de CD’s, venta de chamarras, taller mecánico, tejido de chambritas, venta de camas de bebe.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Raquel es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una Asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de camas de bebe; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus padres que tenían el mismo negocio como negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las ferias de Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "18 de Mayo" (18th of May) will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional center. It consists of 10 members and is led by a board of directors, of which Señora Raquel is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the group run are varied; among them are selling soft drinks, selling CDs, selling jackets, mechanics workshop, knitting baby sweaters, and selling baby beds.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little microentrepreneurs, of which Señora Raquel is one. She indicates that this is the first year that she has been part of Pro Mujer, having become a member at the invitation of a counselor from the institution who went to visit her at home. Now she has a business of selling bedding for babies. She makes known that she learned this business a number of years ago from her parents, who had the same business as a family business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy fabric, which she will acquire from the fairs in the city of La Paz, and after making the bedding she will sell it in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family, since she lives in a free union relationship and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the areas of credit, health, and training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric for baby bedding

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARCO IRIS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vilma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de camas, venta de comida, venta de velas, venta de cereales, venta de papas, venta de cosméticos, carnicería, costura de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vilma es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una Asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de carnicería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace veinte años atrás con un poco capital, mismo que con el pasar del tiempo lo incremento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Arco Iris” [Rainbow] community bank will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the regional office of Villa Exaltación. It is made up of eight members and is led by a leadership group with Vilma as the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are: selling beds, selling food, selling candles, selling grains, selling potatoes, selling cosmetics, meat, and sewing clothing.

The loan they will obtain will benefit small business owners where Vilma is a member. She explains that it was three years ago that she joined Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of an advisor at the institution who went to visit her in her house. She currently has a butcher shop. She explains that she started this business twenty years ago with a small amount of capital and over time it grew. 

The loan that she will obtain now is for increasing her capital (buying meat at wholesale price) that she will buy in the markets in the city of La Paz and then sell at her store. This work allows her to earn an income for supporting her family, since she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans, health care, and training that are offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Aba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming a petty trader. 

Currently, she prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves) at Abura in the Central Region. She has been doing so for about fifteen years. She is divorced and has seven children. She uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales. Aba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is 44 years old and she lives in Vanadzor in the Lori region. Gohar is married and she has two daughters; the elder one is already married and lives separately with her family. Gohar works as an inspector at the local gas station and gas supplying center. As she says, her work is very tense and she has responsibility, but she does her work properly and with pleasure. Together with her husband who also works, they try to provide good living conditions to their family and they also try to help their elder daughter financially. 

Gohar asks for a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams in order to repair the water line at her house and also to get a water heater in order to improve and make everyday life more comfortable.

loans.use: to repair the water line at her house and also to get a water heater in order to improve and make everyday life more comfortable.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a 48-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 16-years-old to 24-years-old. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk for selling. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be that animal feed is expensive. He will use the  20,000 KES loan to buy more dairy cows and animal feed. His business goal is to be a major milk distributor within five years.

He hopes that in the future, he will create employment for youth and raise their living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and pay his employees.

loans.use: buy more dairy cows and animal feed.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Julieta, de 21 años, está casada y tiene un hijo de 03 años con quien vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Julieta consiste en la venta de diversos cosméticos como talcos, cremas corporales, perfumes, lociones, polvos faciales, lápiz labial, aretes, collares y otros. Se encarga de repartir entre sus amigas, vecinas y familiares quienes le solicitan con anterioridad cada artículo de su preferencia. Tiene en su casa una vitrina de exhibición en donde muestra los productos que tiene en stock. Lleva con éste trabajo 2 años, le va bien hasta ahora y tiene la ayuda de su esposo. Cuando se inició en éste negocio estaba muy llena de dudas e inseguridades, pero sus ganas por seguir adelante se impusieron y poco a poco fue aprendiendo la manera adecuada de sacarle provecho a su actividad. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.2200, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos, está comprometida al pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. 
Con el monto solicitado comprará más cosméticos para continuar con su negocio, tales como perfumes, talcos, cremas corporales, cremas faciales y otros.
texts.en:
Julieta is 21 years old. She is married and has a three year old son. They live in their own home. Julieta's work consist of selling various types of cosmetics like talcum powder, body cream, perfume, lotions, facial powders, lipstick, earrings, necklaces etc. 

She distributes what friends, family members and neighbors prefer and have  already ordered. She has a display window in her house where she has an exhibit of the products that she has in stock. She has been doing this for two years and things are going well for her. She has the help of her husband. When she started this work she was filled with doubts and insecurity, buy her desire to get ahead won out and little by little she learned how to make a profit from this activity. 

Julieta is requesting a loan of 2200 PEN. She is grateful to the people who make possible this loan which allows her to continue to work to achieve her objectives. She promises to pay her installments in a timely and responsible manner. With the loan she will purchase more cosmetics to continue with her business like perfume. talcum powder, body  cream, facial cream, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like perfume, talcum powder, body  cream, facial cream, etc.

loans.name: Ruksana

texts.en:
Ruksana is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been doing business manufacturing ‘waan’, which is a thread like material used in making Charpoy (a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and she has become famous in providing good quality waan in her community. 

Ruksana operates the machine at home with the help of her husband. They are contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. She is a mother of three children and is trying hard to fulfill the needs of her children. She requires improving her business, so she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy another ‘waan’ making machine to increase her production. She hopes to get an increase in her earnings through her lager sales.

loans.use: to buy another ‘waan’ making machine.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 43-year-old married lady. she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate healthier source of income. 

She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history. She dreams of providing better standards of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Saffia

texts.en:
Saffia is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community. She offers various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and counts a good client list. Her husband is working as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of five children and motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of detergents along with grocery items, such as grains, sugar, and salts, in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

She wishes to spend part of revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of detergents along with grocery items, such as grains, sugar, and salts, in large quantities.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from the Saramej village of the Lori region where she lives with her husband, parents-in-law and three school-aged children. 

Naira and her family have been involved in agriculture for seven years already. They run a farm which includes chickens, pigs, and cows and they also cultivate haricot and potatoes. Naira's husband sells all the products (meat, milk and eggs) at the nearby wholesale market to re-sellers. 

Both Naira and her husband do their best to have some more income and better living conditions for their family. They need a loan of USD 2,000 to be able to purchase forage to feed the livestock. 

Naira took a loan from a local financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions she wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Naira was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan will be a great support for this family, and they hope for your support.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed the livestock

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Isatu from Waterloo2 Western Rural, Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with one child. 

In 2010, Isatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, six days per week. She says that the major problem for her business is a transportation problem within her operation area.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to open a big provision store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Don Rodolfo es originario de la ciudad de Managua, casado y padre de dos hijos ya independientes. Tiene 52 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de quesillos y tiste. Inicio su negocio muy joven, vendiendo quesillos y tiste en un mercado popular de la ciudad. Su mayor sueño es ser un artista musical de canciones nicaragüenses. Su meta próxima es realizar un álbum musical propio que contenga una recopilación de música nacional. Solicita el crédito para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los productos que ofrece tales como: Tortilla, Quesillo, Crema, sal entre otros. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que aumentara sus ventas y mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia. Su plan futuro es grabar un disco con canciones populares nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
Don Rodolfo is from the ciudad of Managua. He is married and the father of two children who are now grownups. He is 52 years old. He is a businessman who makes a living selling cheeses and "tiste" [beverage made from cornmeal and cocoa powder]. He started his business when he was very young, selling cheeses and "tiste" at a popular city market. His biggest dream is to be a musician of Nicaraguan songs. His next goal is to create his own music album that is a compilation of national music.

He is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients necessary for producing the goods he sells, including tortillas, cheese, cream, and salt, among others. He thinks that the loan will be beneficial since it will increase his sales and improve his family's quality of life. His future plan is to record an album with popular Nicaraguan songs.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for manufacturing products such as tortillas, cheese, cream, and salt.

loans.name: Francisca Eva

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 62 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene cuatro hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos vive en en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios. 

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias. 

Francisca se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves. Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquirir algunos insumos. Enfrenta desafios como el clima.

El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas liquidos para la maleza y semilla de arroz. La meta es tener dinero para realizar un viaje por las playas de nuestro pais. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar musica romantica del recuerdo.
texts.en:
Francisca is 62 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has 4 children. She lives with her partner and their children in the town of Mocache in the Los Rios province.

Her communal bank is called '27 de octubre' and is located in the Sara Guerrero community in the town of Mocache. The members there work in agriculture and raise livestock.

Francisca works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She makes her purchases in Mocache at the market on Thursdays. With the money, she has been able to meet some needs, such as paying for labor and obtaining some supplies. She faces challenges though, such as the weather.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of fertilizers, manure, seeds, weed killer, and rice seeds. Her goal is to have money to take a trip to her country's beaches. In her free time, she likes to listen to romantic music.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, weed killer, and rice seeds.

loans.name: Ancocagua Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANCOCAGUA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, tejido de mantas, costura de blusas, venta de queso, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elena es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que visitó su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo asumió por iniciativa propia al observar que este producto es un producto que es muy comercial.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, verduras) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que se realizan en el grupo.
texts.en:
The A.C. "ANCOCAGUA" will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Copacabana regional center.  It has nine members and is directed by a board  of which Elena is the president. The members' businesses are varied and they include: fish sales, blanket weaving, sewing blouses, cheese sales, and livestock sales. The loan they take out will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs, including  Elena. She says that three years ago she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a sponsor of the institution who visited her house. 

Currently, Elena has a business selling food items, and she states that she started this business on her own when she noticed that this product is very much in demand. The loan she is taking out is to increase working capital to buy rice, noodles, and vegetables which she will buy from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. After preparing her dishes she will sell them from her stall.  This type of work allows her to make some money to support her family, as she is married and has six children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the savings that the group makes.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and vegetables

loans.name: Wastaarabu Group

texts.en:
Hatibu, who is in his late 20's, is single but living with his young brother and sister who are in school. For three years now, Hatibu has engaged with two businesses. One is graphics, in which he edits pictures, films videos, and designs signs. He also a farmer growing rice. Hatibu  works from 8 AM  to 8 PM per working day and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This will be his third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. His previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, were used to buy a business printer, business photo albums, frames, and other working capital items.   He is doing great and it shows. Hatibu has used his business profit to finish building his house and has covered school fees and home expenses. With this loan, Hatibu will add anotter portion of land for growing rice. He dreams to be a successful man. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, Wastaarbu, which consists of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to add anotther portion of land for growing rice.

loans.name: Sheraton Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her mid 30's, is single with a boy in school. For more than ten years now, Fatuma has been managing her living by running a business selling soccer jerseys. She usually sells them door to door and sometimes at the football stadium when there is a soccer match. She has two temporary helpers who can join her to sell jerseys at the time of the soccer match. She also prints famous players names on the back of the jerseys for selling. Fatuma works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to restock football jerseys and she sold them all. With her business profit, she bought a plot of land, a television, and covered school fees and home expenses. She will use this loan to buy new football (soccer) jerseys for selling at the upcoming football tournament. She dreams to own a business property. 

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, "Sheraton," which totals 3 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new football (soccer) jerseys for selling at the upcoming football tournament.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Even though Efua grew up in difficult circumstance, she is a successful petty trader. She sells cooked rice and vegetable stew at Abura, located in the central region. She is married to a mason and has two children. Efua has been working in this business for fifteen years. She uses all her income to support her husband to feed and provide for the entire family.

Efua’s loan will be used to purchase an increased amount of rice and other ingredients she needs to sustain her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her current business and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into the neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase rice and other ingredients she needs to sustain her business.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 37-year-old married father with two children who has been working as a fisherman since 1990. He is a hard worker who puts much effort into developing his business so that he can provide his family with all the things it needs. Fadi is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy fishing supplies such as nets, and many other tools to help him develop his business and increase his income. He hopes that in the future he'll be able to buy another boat and grow his business greatly.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies such as nets and other tools to help develop his business and increase his income.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 50-year-old married father of three children. He has worked in selling clothes since 1993. He is his family's sole breadwinner, which forces him to put out extra effort to develop his business in order to make sure that he can reply to his precious family's increasing needs.

Mazen is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special Christmas and newly released winter collections that will attract customers' attention and increase his sales.

This is Mazen's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good standing paying back history. His previous loans helped him a lot in increasing his business capital through diversifying his products upon customers' requests.

He is working hard to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special Christmas and newly released winter collections that will attract customers' attention and increase his sales

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра 47-летняя замужняя женщина. Она проживает в районе Кубадиён и занимается там животноводством. Последние два года Гулчехра выращивает крупнорогатый скот с целью дальнейшей продажи. Все члены семьи помогают ей в данном бизнесе. Они обычно откармливают скот в течение месяца и затем продают на скотном рынке. Это у них совместный семейный бизнес. Гулчехра нуждается в кредите. У нее сейчас в скотном дворе осталось только одна корова с теленком. Она собирается купить несколько голов крупнорогатого скота и корма, и тем самым расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a 47 year old married woman. She lives in the Kubadiyon region and raises livestock. For the past two years she has raised cattle to sell. Her family helps her with the business. They usually feed the cattle for a month and then sell them at the livestock market. It is a family business. Gulchehra needs a loan because she only has one cow and calf left in the barn. She is going to buy feed and a few head of cattle to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is from Gogaran village of Lori region. He lives with his mother, wife, and two little kids (ages five and two years old). Mher has been involved in agriculture and farming for 15 years. He has a plot of land and a small farm where he has a cow and three piglets. Time by time, Mher also provides renovation services to locals and nearby communities. But the main income of the family comes from the farming business and Mher would like to increase it. 

He applied for a loan of USD 2,000 to be able to purchase seeds for cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock. Mher has taken a loan from local financial institution before, but because of family's poor conditions, he wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to his hard work during the recent times, Mher was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

The loan will be a huge support to this farmer to be able to enlarge his farm and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds for cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, age 27 years, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in the produce business and has a store located in a busy trading center. His clients are the locals. To supplement his income, Emmanuel practices farming and sells spare parts. He is a hard working man who desires to have a personal farm in the future. Weather changes and poor roads are the challenges he faces.

Emmanuel is in need of a loan to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to resell.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Twenty-eight year old Benard is married and the father of one child who lives in Hoima, Uganda. He earns a living by selling produce and makes additional income by farming. He started his produce business after borrowing funds from the person he was working for. Using a little savings from his salary, he opened up a produce store and has been in business for three years now. Constant weather changes and the occasional low quality of his supplies are problems he faces. But, because he is a shrewd businessman, he would like to buy an Isuzu truck to transport items around for his business. Benard is requesting a loan to buy more maize, beans and nuts to sell.

loans.use: buy more maize, beans and nuts to sell.

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon lives in the Syunik region in the city Kapan. He is 43 years old. He is married and he has a son and a daughter. Both of them are already grown-up and they work; his daughter works at the pharmacy and his son works at the bread workshop as a distributer of bread. Levon’s wife has a specialty of musician and she works at the kindergarten. 

This family is very nice and united and they do everything to help and support each other. As Levon says, like all families, in his family also exist problems and financial difficulties, but since they love each other so much and even too much, they overcome everything and there is no question that remains without answer or explanation. 

Levon also supports his family financially; in his own car he gives taxi services. He likes his job, since as he says every day he meets his friends and neighbors, some familiar people, who have become his loyal customers. With them he likes to communicate and have a talk.

 Levon asks a loan of 500,000 AMD in order to repair his car engine and also to buy tires for his car to drive safely in a snowy weather.

loans.use: to repair his car engine and also to buy tires for his car to drive safely in snowy weather

loans.name: Jorge Hilario

texts.es:
Jorge Hilario tiene 18 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se encuentra cerca al valle del rio Jequetepeque, favoreciendo a la agricultura, la población también se dedica al comercio y ganadería, ubicado a una hora con cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes a las comunidades a aledañas a su distrito, también ofrece servicio como jornalero.

Jorge ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para completar con lo que tiene ahorrado para la compra de un lote de terreno.
texts.en:
Jorge Hilario is 18 years old and lives with his parents in the Zaña district, a community located near the Jequetepeque River Valley, favoring agriculture and the people there are also merchants and raise livestock.  It’s located one hour and forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides public transportation services with his moto-taxi, transporting his clients to the communities near his district.  He also works as a laborer.

Jorge is asking for a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to add to his savings and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и  имеет одного ребёнка. Рустам со своей женой живут счастливо, и стараются воспитывать своего ребёнка в достатке. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Рустам занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении нескольких лет он занимается купля продажей фруктов и овощей. Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай. Он перевозит на собственной грузовой машине урожай в город на рынок для продажи. А также покупает на рынке другого вида овощи и фрукты и продаёт их в своём селе. Этот бизнес приносит ему постоянный хороший доход. И сейчас Рустам хочет расширить свой бизнес, обустроить возле своего дома небольшой прилавок, где его жена будет продавать разнообразные овощи и фрукты. Поэтому он хочет взять кредит для покупки большого ассортимента овощей и фруктов. Для получения кредита он обратился в Арванд и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Rustam is a good-natured 30-year-old man who is married and the father of one child. He and his wife lead a happy life and are doing all they can to give a good life to their child.  Rustam makes a living from his own business and has been involved in buying and selling fruits and vegetables for a few years already.  He used to work on a mid-size farm in the past, but he then decided to sell his own harvest.  Using his own truck, he now transports his crops and sells them at the market in town.   He also buys other types of fruits and vegetables at the market and resells them in his own store.  This business brings him a stable and good income.

Rustam now wants to expand his business and he would also like to build a small kiosk, next to his house, where his wife could sell fruits and vegetables.  He plans to use his loan to buy a large selection of fruits and vegetables.  He has turned to Arvand to receive this loan, and he is hoping for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 49 year-old Mariama from Waterloo, in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with five children. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

Mariama runs a retails business where she sell drinks and palm oil for resale. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 12 hours per day. Mariama says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operating area.

Mariama has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, drinks and Gari to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, drinks and Gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Shefqet

texts.en: With the previous loan he was able to buy fodder for the animals thanks to the lenders. Shefqet wants to repair his family home this time and is seeking your help again.

loans.use: to repair his family home.

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin has been married for 20 years and has two sons. The members of his family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) who once lived in Agdam city and now live in the Abseron region. His wife cares for their home while he works in construction. He uses many different materials, including wallpaper, putty, plaster, etc. His older son has finished school and is now learning this profession from his father. His younger son is in the eleventh grade. Today Aydin wants to expand his business, and has applied for a loan for 1,900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy construction materials which he will use in his work. He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help. In the future, Aydin hopes to complete raising his children and see that they have successful marriages and rewarding lives.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Unión Ninfas - Joyitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN NINFAS - JOYITAS” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jeanett es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de zapatos, venta de ropa, venta de jugos, venta de jugos, venta de refrescos, venta de material escolar, venta de comida, venta de comida de pollo, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, tejido a macramé.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jeanett es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermano que es socio de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de esencias; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus padres, ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posteriormente con un pequeño capital decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de esencias) que adquirirá de las fábricas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener sus estudios.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

Dos señoras no se identifican en la imagen porque hicieron se encontraban detras de otra compañera del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Unión Ninfas - Joyitas" will begin its 14th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Regional Center. It is composed of 11 members and is led by a board of directors, of which Señora Jeanett is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied; among them are selling shoes, selling clothing, selling juices, selling juices, selling soft drinks, selling school supplies, selling food, selling chicken dishes, neighborhood store, selling cosmetics, and weaving macramé.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little microentrepreneurs, of which Señora Jeanett is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, entering at the invitation of her brother, who is a member of the institution. Now she has a business of selling fragrances. She lets it be known that she learned this business a number of years ago from her parents, since this was a family business.
