Later, with a little capital, she decided to set up an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy fragrances, which she will acquire from the factories in the city of El Alto, and later she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to continue her studies.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the areas of credit, health, and training that the institution offers.

Two women cannot be identified in the photo because they were behind other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy fragrances

loans.name: Nuevo Corazon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO CORAZON” iniciará el vigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Reina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tejido, venta de muebles, venta de carne de cordero, bordado de ropa de moreno, tejido de enaguas, venta de artículos de celular, venta de dulces, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Reina es integrante, ella indica que hace once ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de partes de celulares; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió hace doce años atrás, ya que conocía del negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de partes de celulares) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que se desarrollan en el grupo.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Corazon” communal bank will begin its twenty third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the regional office in German Busch. It is made up of eight members and led by a leadership group where Reina is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are: selling weavings, selling furniture, selling lamb meat, embroidery, underskirts, cell phone accessories, sweets, and transportation services.
	
The loan they will obtain will benefit the small business owners where Reina is a member. She explains that she joined Pro Mujer eleven years ago. She joined at the invitation of a friend who was a member of the institution. She currently has a store where she sells cell phone parts. She explains that she started this business twelve years ago because she knew the business.

The loan that she will obtain will be for increasing capital (buying cell phone parts) that she will get at the wholesale stores in the city of La Paz. She will sell them in her store. This work allows her to earn an income to support her family, since she lives in a common law marriage and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the saving that the group builds up.

loans.use: to buy cell phone parts

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children in a nice house. For more than 10 years, Armen has his own business; he has a car service center. He mainly changes car engines. Before, he used to do passenger transportation using his own car, from Vanadzor to Yerevan and back. 

Armen is well known in his city, since he works cutely and with responsibility. His loyal customers mention that they trust him and know that Armen will surely repair their cars any time, with a convenient price for both of them.
 
Armen asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) in order to buy car engines and some special tools for his everyday work.

loans.use: to buy car engines and special tools for his everyday work.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a farm where she grows bananas to sell, and keeps dairy cows that produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a suitable place. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and animal feeds. Her business goal is to have five dairy cows within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to invest more in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feeds.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows bananas and sweet potatoes for sale and also keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a favorable place. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase pesticides for use in her farm. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to invest in other businesses.

loans.use: purchase pesticides for use in her farm

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although Ekua grew up in poverty without an education,  this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she earns a living by preparing and selling kenkey, a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough that is wrapped in banana leaves. She sells most of her kenkey in Abura, Cape Coast. She uses the income from her business to help her husband (who is a farmer) cover the cost of raising their four children. Ekua believes that there is growing demand among customers for her kenkey but she is unable to meet their needs due to limited supplies. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of maize and other supplies to increase her output. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua wants to ensure that all of her children will be given the opportunity to escape poverty and live rewarding lives.

loans.use: to buy maize and other ingredients for her tasty kenkey.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Jajur village. She teaches at the local school and together with her husband also runs a farm. Aida lives with her husband, daughter and mother-in-law. Their farm includes livestock (cows, sheep, pigs and chickens) and they also cultivate wheat and grass. They use grass as forage for the livestock. Now, Aida has applied for this loan to be able to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation of the land. Aida will be very thankful to lenders who support her farming. 

Aida received a loan from a local financial institution in the past, but unfortunately was not able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work recently, Susanna was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. Consequently, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan is a hope for Aida and her husband and they wait for lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivating the land

loans.name: Bella Herminia

texts.es:
Bella tiene 42 años de edad es soltera tiene una hija de 16 años de edad, vive con la hija vive en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios. 

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias. 

Bella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves. Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquirir algunos insumos. Enfrenta desafios como la competencia.

El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas liquidos para la maleza. La meta es seguir trabajando en la agricultura para tener as ingresos para ayudar a la hija que siga estudiando. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver la television.
texts.en:
Bella is 42 years old and single.  She has a 16-year-old daughter.  She lives with her daughter in the Mocache canton which belongs to the province of Los Ríos.  Her communal bank, “27 de Octubre” (October 27th), is located in the Sara Guerrero district which belongs to the Mocache canton.  The people here work in agriculture and raising livestock. 

Bella works in agriculture planting corn.  She makes her purchases in Mocache at the market on Thursdays.  With the money she has been able to meet some needs like paying for labor and acquiring some supplies.  She faces challenges such as competition. 

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase fertilizers, manure, seeds and liquid weed-killer.  Her goal is to continue working in agriculture in order to have more income to help her daughter to continue her studies.  

In her free time she likes to watch television.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, seeds and liquid weed-killer.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 28-year-old hardworking man with two children in school living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is teaching alongside running a salon. He is facing challenges of low salary paid to him and limited capital to aid his expansion. However, he has a vision of having a renowned salon in town. Julius needs a loan to boost his family income and buy a new machine for his business.

loans.use: to boost his family income and buy a new machine for his business.

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Victorine lives outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County in south-western Kenya, which borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit-tree plantations.

Victorine is married and has nine children. She works at a small business of her own, while her husband farms and sells clothes. She has been farming for 18 years, and is currently growing maize, kale, local vegetables, amaranth, beans, lentils and sunflowers, as well as tending to goats and poultry. She is looking forward to owning beehives because the bees will help pollinate her crops, increasing yields of her beans, lentils and sunflowers. 

This is Victorine’s first loan, and she plans to use the income she ears to pay school fees for her children and cover the cost of her family’s basic needs. She would like to thank Kiva lenders and asks them to “support more people to take up beekeeping because it is a very good project especially for women.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa interior, venta de juguetes, tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas y chompas, venta de zapatillas, venta de pescado, servicio de albañil.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una sobrina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatillas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace veinte años atrás al observar que este producto era muy atractivo para el mercado paceño.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zapatillas) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA" begins its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Villa Exaltacion. It is comprised of eight members and is led by a board of which Angelica is the President. Among the various businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are: selling lingerie, selling toys, a neighborhood store, weaving blankets and sweaters, selling shoes, selling fish, and bricklayer service. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs of which Angelica is an integral part. She indicates that it has been a year since she joined Pro Mujer, having entered by an invitation from a niece who is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling shoes; she discloses that she undertook this business twenty years ago upon seeing that this product was very attractive to the La Paz market.

The loan that she is now taking out is for capital increase (purchase of shoes) that she will acquire from vendors from the City of La Paz and will subsequently sell in her retail space. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is a single woman and has a son.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she enjoys the healthcare field that the institution offers.

loans.use: buy shoes

loans.name: 15 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “15 DE AGOSTO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, tejido de mantas, venta de queso, venta de comida, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilda es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que visitó su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de agricultura; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de sus padres ya que este es un negocio familiar, cuando se casó decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas de papa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente al cultivo lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que se realizan en el grupo.
texts.en:
The communal association "15 DE AGOSTO" begins its third cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi. It is comprised of nine members and is led by a directive board of which Hilda is the President. Among the various businesses which the members carry out are: selling fish, weaving blankets, selling cheese, selling food, and selling fruit. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs of which Hilda is a member. She indicates that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, having joined by an invitation of a promoter who visited her home. Today she has a farming business; she discloses that she learned this business from her parents as it is a family business. When she married, she decided to start an independent business.

The loan that she is taking out now is for capital increase (buying potato seeds) that she will acquire from vendors of the City of La Paz and then to the cultivation of what she will market in her retail space. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has two children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings that are made in the group.

loans.use: buy potato seeds

loans.name: Retamas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RETAMAS” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ruth es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas y dulces, tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, costura de calzados, taller de chapería y pintura, venta de comida, venta de aji, taller de mecánica, venta de CD’s

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ruth es integrante, ella indica que es el cuarto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace años atrás, ya que su comercio está cercano a un establecimiento educativo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces) que adquirirá de las ferias de Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Retamas" will begin its eighth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional center. It consists of nine members and is led by a board of directors, where Señora Ruth is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied; among them are selling blankets and sweets, knitting blankets, neighborhood store, sewing footwear, auto body repair and painting, selling food, selling peppers, mechanic's workshop, and selling CDs.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little microentrepreneurs, of which Señora Ruth is one. She indicates that this is the fourth year that she has been a member of Pro Mujer, having joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Now she has a business of selling sweets. She lets it be known that she began this business some years ago, since her business is near an educational institution.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy sweets, which she will acquire from the fairs in the city of La Paz and later sell in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family, since she lives in a free union relationship and has a son.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the areas of credit, health, and training that the institution offers her.

loans.use: to buy sweets to sell

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Né vers 1958 à BLADIE /GARALO, DJENEBA  réside à KEBILA  dans la (Sous-Préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) avec son mari et ses 10 enfants dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Mme DJENEBA  s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales. Elle est très sollicitée au marché de KEBILA et surtout les jours de foire. 
Fort de ses 20 années d’expériences dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir remboursé le prêt précédent. 
DJENEBA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de céréales. Elle s’approvisionne chez les producteurs de KEBILA et environnant. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché généralement aux consommateurs.
DJENEBA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1958 in Bladie/Garalo, Djeneba now lives in Kebila in the 3rd administrative region of Mali with her ​​husband and 10 children in a traditional Malian family. Djeneba became quickly interested in income-generating activities, most notably the purchase and resale of grains. She is much sought-after at the market in Kebila, especially on market days 

With over 20 years of experience in this trade, Djeneba is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso to increase her working capital so that she can better satisfy her constantly expanding customer base. She is on her second loan after repaying the previous loan.

Djeneba intends to use this loan to buy 10 bags of grain. She buys from producers and in and around Kebila, conducting her sales in cash and sometimes on credit to customers at the market. Djeneba hopes to make a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA, which she will use to support her family, repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase grains.

loans.name: 5 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “5 DE ABRIL” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria Elena es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de anticuchos, tienda de barrio, venta de revistas, servicio de transporte, venta de CD’s, venta de comida,  venta de ropa, venta de juguetes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria Elena es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas que son socias en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de CD’s; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió conjuntamente su hermana que tiene un negocio paralelo al suyo desde hace cinco años decide emprender su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de CD’s) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta ahorro que se tiene en la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "5 DE ABRIL" will begin its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. It is comprised of eight members and is led by a directive board of which Maria Elena is the Secretary. Among that various businesses that the members carry out are: selling kebabs, a neighborhood store, selling magazines, a transportation service, selling CDs, selling food, selling clothing, and selling toys. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs of which Maria Elena is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, having joined by an invitation from her friends that are members of the institution. Today she has a business selling CDs; she discloses that she learned this business jointly with her sister, who has had a business similar to hers for five years, and she decided to start her own work space.

The loan that she will take out now is for capital increase (buying CD's) which she will acquire from the traditional fairs of the City of El Alto and then she will market them in her work space. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has a son.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings that are made in the institution.

loans.use: buy CD's

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES UNIDAS” iniciará el décimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Inés es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, venta de hiervas, costura de chamarras, tejido de macramé, venta de refrescos, confección de prendas de vestir, venta de fruta, venta de cosméticos, taller electrónico.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Inés es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de prendas de vestir; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió hace once años atrás, conjuntamente su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, el crédito y el área de salud que se ofrece en la institución.
texts.en:
The lending group "Women United" will begin their 18th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch focal center. The group is made up of 10 members and has a board of directors lead by the President, Ines. The members have varied businesses including: grocery store, selling herbs, sewing coats, knitting macrame, selling sodas, making garments, fruit sales, cosmetics, and an electronics workshop.

The loan will benefit these small business owners, like Ines. She has been through three cycles with Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend of hers who is a member. Currently she has a business making clothing. She started the business with her family 11 years ago. This loan will be used to increase her capital buy purchasing fabric in the wholesale stores in the city of La Paz. Later she will make garments to sell in her store. This work allows her to generate income to sustain her family. Ines is married an has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings, the loan, and the health talks that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Mina De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MINA DE ORO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: cría y venta de ganado, producción de mantas, servicio de transporte público, venta de productos medicinales, venta de repuestos, venta de ovejas, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas que son socias en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió porque apoyaba a en el negocio familiar, posteriormente a que tuvo su pareja decide implementar un espacio de trabajo independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la frontera Perú - Bolivia y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta ahorro que se tiene en la institución.
texts.en:
The lending group "Mina de Oro" [Gold Mine] will begin their second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focal center of Senkata. The group has 8 members and a board of directors led by the president, Julia. The members have various businesses including: raising cattle, making blankets, public transportation, selling medicinal products, selling repair parts, selling sheep, and sewing blankets.

This loan will benefit small business owners like Julia, who has been a part of Pro Mujer for two years, joining at the invitation of her friends who are members. Currently she has a sewing business. She learned it because she helped out in the family business, and later when she got married she decided to work independently. The loan will help her to buy fabric in the traditional markets on the Peruvian-Bolivian border and later she will make things to sell in her store. This work allows her to generate income to sustain her family - her husband and two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the savings that she has in the institution.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Kankou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1973 à KANGABA, KANKOU  réside à BOHI dans la (Sous-Préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) avec  son mari et son  enfant 1 dans une famille nucléaire.
 Mme Kankou s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat   vente des  pagnes wax, chaussures et bijoux. Elle est très sollicitée dans son village à BOHI. 
Fort de ses 4 années d’expériences dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois dans le but d’augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir. 
Kankou  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes à Bamako et souvent à  Bougouni et effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit dans sa famille et au marché.
Kankou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in Kangaba, Kankou lives in Bohi in the 3rd administrative region of Mali with her husband and child in a nuclear family. Kankou became quickly interested in income-generating activities, notably the purchase and resale of wax pagnes, shoes and jewelry. She is much sought-after in her village at Bohi.

With four years of experience in this trade, Kankou is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso for the first time to increase her working capital so that she can better satisfy her constantly expanding customer base. 

Kankou will use this loan to purchase 10 lengths of wax pagnes. She purchases from producers in Bamako and often in Bougouni, and she makes her sales in cash and sometimes on credit through her family and at the market. Kankou hopes to generate a monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA which she will use to meet the needs of her family, repay the loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase wax pagnes (traditional printed fabrics)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Mary is married, and has seven children. Mary used to work as a tailor, but has since retired, while her husband is a private accounts auditor. She has been farming for eighteen years and is currently growing beans, lentils, amaranth, sunflower, millet, and beans as well as raising sheep, poultry, and cattle. Mary is excited to start beekeeping because she will have honey for use as medicine and also to eat with bread. 

This is Mary’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to pay the school fees for her children and provide for their basic needs. Her hope for the future is to expand beekeeping, she says there is an “age limit to farming and beekeeping is a good alternative.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania, and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Sabina is married and has thirteen children. Sabina has a business selling rice and baskets, while her husband works with a local nongovernmental organization. She has been farming for 25 years and is currently growing maize, millet, groundnuts, lentils, cowpeas, and beans, as well as rearing goats, sheep, and cows. 

This is Sabina’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to help pay her children’s school fees, as well as start sunflower farming. She wanted to thank Kiva lenders for enabling her to access loans for her hives.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Group

texts.fr: Madame Nyangolo est leader du groupe JIPE Moyo, âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 11 enfants tous scolarisés.Son conjoint est un commerçant des divers.Avec le nouveau crédit de Hekima, elle veut acheter 50 paires de souliers. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite élargir  son entreprise, et construire une belle maison. Il y a plus de  30 ans  qu’elle  exerce ce commerce. Elle avait commencé son commerce avec le fonds propre reçu de son mari. Elle remercie hekima pour le soutien accordé aux femmes non bancables surtout pendant ce moment des conflits armées à l'Est de la RDC.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nyangolo is the leader of group JIPE Moyo. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of eleven children, who all go to school. Her husband is a retailer of sundry items.
With Hekima’s new loan, she wants to purchase 50 pairs of shoes. In the future, she wants to grow her business and build a beautiful house. She has been in this business for over 30 years. She started her business with capital received from her husband.
She thanks Hekima for the support granted to women without access to banking, especially at this time of armed conflicts in Eastern DRC (Democratic Republic of the Congo).

loans.use: to purchase 50 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Shant

texts.en:
Shant lives in Haykadzor Village. He is a farmer who lives with his parents and 17-year-old brother. Shant and his family own a big livestock farm which includes sheep, cows, pigs, piglets, chickens and nine colonies of bees. The whole family has been involved in farming activities and they all work hard to develop their farm.

Shant has now applied for this loan to be able to enlarge the livestock with 20 more sheep as well as to purchase special forage for feeding them. The loan will be a huge support for the whole family to continue developing their farm.

As this is Shant's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who don’t have access to credit products because they have no credit history.

Shant hopes for the loan's support and the loan will be a huge support for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay for 20 sheep and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en: Kasifa is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school.  She has a business selling and growing mushrooms and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more mushroom seeds.  She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.  She sells to all supermarkets around her area. She sells on wholesale and works three days out of every week.  Her major business challenges are seasonality and the lack of enough markets. She aspires to educate her children, buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more mushroom seeds.

loans.name: Luceritos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCERITOS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de papa frita, venta de comida, venta de pollos, venta de fruta, trenzado de mantas, tienda de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rita es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas que son socias en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de taller de tejido de chompas y mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años después de aprender la técnica de tejido decide realizar la venta de estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la frontera Perú - Bolivia y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la fotografpía nos acompañan dos amigas del grupo que acompañaron a sus familiares, ellas estan con un sombrero blanco y con una chompa azul clara.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Luceritos" will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional center. It consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors, where Señora Rita is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied; among them are selling blankets, selling fried potatoes, selling food, selling chickens, selling fruit, weaving blankets, and a shoe store.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little microentrepreneurs, of whom Señora Rita is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, entering at the invitation of her friends who are members of the institution. Now she has a business, a workshop for knitting sweaters and blankets. She lets it be known that she learned this business a number of years ago. After learning knitting techniques, she decided to sell these products.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy wool, which she will acquire from the traditional fairs on the Peru-Bolivia border, and after making her products she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate income to maintain her family, since she is married and has five children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers her.

The photograph includes two friends of the group who accompanied their relatives. One is wearing a white hat, and one has a bright blue sweater.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Nueva Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA SOLIDARIDAD”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Agustina es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller mecánico, tienda de barrio, venta de queso, venta de celulares, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Agustina es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió al trabajar de ayudante de cocina en un establecimiento, posteriormente decide emprender su propio espacio de comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud que se ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The lending group "New Solidarity" will begin their third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focal center Alto Lima. The group has nine members and a board of directors including the treasurer, Agustina. The members have various businesses such as: mechanic, neighborhood store, selling cheese, selling cell phones, selling food.

The loan will benefit small business owners like Agustina, who has been with Pro Mujer for three years, joining at the invitation of a promoter who went to visit her at home. Currently she has a business selling food. She learned by helping out in the kitchen at a restaurant and later decided to open her own space. The loan will be used to buy things like rice, noodles and oil in the wholesale stores in La Paz, and later to make the food she will sell. This work allows her to generate income to maintain her home as much as possible, since is married and has 6 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loan and the health information that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, oil.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RIOS DE AGUA VIVA” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ines es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de comida, elaboración ropa y comerciante de víveres, producción de cotillones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Inés es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de cotillones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, al trabajar anteriormente en una tienda similar, posteriormente a su matrimonio decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cartón y papel) que adquirirá de las tienda mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y el trabajo en grupo.
texts.en:
The lending group "Rios de Agua Viva" will begin their 11th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focal center of the Andes. The group has 8 members and a board of directors led by the president, Ines. The lending group members have various businesses including: food service, making clothing, selling groceries, and making party favors.

This loan will benefit small business owners like Ines, who has been with Pro Mujer for 7 years, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member. Currently she has a business making and selling party favors. She started the business some years ago, having previously worked in a similar shop. After getting married she decided to open up her own business. This loan will be used to buy paper and cardboard in the wholesale shops in El Alto that she will later use to make her product. This work allows her to generate income to sustain her family - she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health information and working with a group.

loans.use: to buy paper and cardboard.

loans.name: Singida Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi, who is in her late 40s, is single with three children. One of her children is in school and the other two have finished school. For seven years now, Mwanahamisi has been managing her family by running a restaurant. She works from 7 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her fourth loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. Mwanahamisi used her previous loans to replace old working equipment like a few tables and chairs. She also bought more stock of cooking supplies. With her profit, she bought a plot of land and paid for food expenses and school fees. Mwanahamisi will use this loan to buy new business tables, chairs and other working equipment. She dreams of improving her business, owning a house and owning a private car.

She will share this loan with her loan group SINGIDA,  which consists of six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy tables,chairs and other equipment

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Even though Ekua grew up under difficult circumstance, she is a successful fishmonger. She specializes in selling fried fish at Abura located in the Central Region.  She has been involved in this business for two years. She is married to a carpenter and together they have six children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. Ekua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell more fried fish. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest part of her future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demands and the family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of fish

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 67-year-old single woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 22 to 45 years old. She describes herself to be enterprising. She operates a farm where she grows bananas and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that some of the products she sells are perishable. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a profitable business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Margaret T.

texts.en: Margaret T. lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She 45 year old and unmarried with two children who are 20 and 22 years old. Only one of her children is in school and lives at home. For the past two years, she has been selling doughnuts in the community market. She started this business with help from her fiance and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends eight hours each day on her business and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table. She is requesting a loan to buy more flour, sugar, oil, etc. to expand her sales. She wants to get more money and live a good life.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, and oil to make extra doughnuts

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina tiene 54 años de edad,vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por un clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción y comercio en general, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén,que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de la zona, donde se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, con más de 03 años en el negocio, por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el rubro, brinda un buen servicio.

Marina ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con la compra de arroz, menestras, leche entre otros y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Marina is 54 years old and lives with her daughter in the Pucara district, a community known for its warm climate, where its population raises rice and works as merchants.  It’s located two hours from the city of Jaen and is part of the Cjamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

She has a stall in the local market where she sells primary needs products and has done so for three years.  She has experience and provides good customer service.

Maria is asking for a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to stock her business with rice, groceries, dairy, and other things so that she can offer more to her customers and generate additional income for the family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Né vers  1979 à NAMPASSO C/ KOLONDIEBA, KARIM  réside à KADIANA dans la (Sous-Préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) avec ses 4 enfants et sa femme dans une famille nucléaire.
 Mr KARIM  s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’habits  et prêts à porters.  Il est très sollicité à Kadiana et surtout les jours de foire. 
Fort de ses 14 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois dans le but d’augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir. 
KARIM compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des complets de prêts à porters (chemises et pantalons). Il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes à Bamako. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché à une clientèle mixte.
KARIM espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1979 in Nampasso/Kolondieba, Karim lives in Kadiana in the 3rd administrative region of Mali with his wife and four children in a nuclear family. Karim became quickly interested in income-generating activities, notably the purchase and resale of clothing. He is much sought-after in Kadiana, especially on market days. With 14 years of experience in this trade, Karim is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso for the first time to increase his working capital so that he can better satisfy his constantly expanding customer base. 

Karim intends to use this loan to buy shirts and pants for resale. He purchases from wholesalers in Bamako and conducts his sales in cash and sometimes on credit to customers at his local market. Karim hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which he will use to support his family, repay the loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: Don Silvio, es un señor que trabaja de sol a sol como técnico de pista en bombas de gasolinera, con sus ingresos mantiene a su familia, es padre de 4 hijas menores de edad todas estudiantes y para mantener los gastos del hogar el se apoya con su esposa quien trabaja en un molino que ella administra, don Silvio necesita realizar el cambio del techo de su vivienda que no presta buenas condiciones, solicita el crédito para comprar materiales para esta mejora en su hogar, para que su familia se sienta tranquila y cómoda.
texts.en: Silvio works as a fuel pump technician from sunup to sundown and supports his family with his income.  He has four young daughters and all attend school.  His wife works at a mill that she manages.  Silvio needs to replace the roof on his house because it’s currently in bad shape.  He is asking for a loan to buy building materials so that his family will feel comfortable and relaxed.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from Vanadzor town. He lives there together with his parents who are retired. Artur runs an agribusiness and is the only breadwinner in the family. He keeps livestock including chickens, turkeys, 15 cows and calves and he cultivates grass as forage for the livestock. The cultivated grass isn't enough to feed all the livestock and Artur is unable to purchase other types of forage because of hard financial conditions. Therefore, he has applied for this loan to be able to purchase forage to feed the livestock. The loan will be a huge support for this hard working farmer as he will be able to continue his agribusiness.

Artur has already taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately, he wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to his hard work during recent times, Artur was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, Artur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed his livestock

loans.name: Duc

texts.en: Duc is requesting a new loan to buy new furniture and better food. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his food stall and his sales, and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and better food

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Linh is requesting a new loan to buy a variety of new food products such as sugar and soft drinks to stock in her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales, and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of new food products to sell

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Gordon is married and has four children. He runs a small kiosk selling goods in town and engages in farming his land. He is currently growing maize and millet and tending to his own bees, as well as cultivating natural forests and breeding cows, donkeys, sheep and goats. He thinks that beekeeping is beneficial because it improves the environment and provides honey, which has medicinal properties. 

This is Gordon’s first loan and he plans to use the income to buy food for his family and pay his children’s school fees. His hope for the future is to continue developing his farm and to have educated children

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en: Avtandil is a 55-year-old farmer from the village of Tsitelkhevi. He lives with his wife, his grown son and his daughter-in-law. Avtandil grows maize on his own plot of land and sells his harvest periodically. Avtandil’s son works as a construction worker and earns a monthly income. The family funds are modest and hardly enough to cover their food expenses. In order to generate a stable income, Avtandil plans to start an animal husbandry business and buy sheep and pigs. He will keep the livestock in the shed located in his yard and raise them. After several months, Avtandil will expand his farm and sell lambs and piglets. He wishes to develop his animal husbandry business and breed more livestock in the future.

loans.use: to buy sheep and pigs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Helen is married and has nine children. Both Helen and her husband farm, but also have businesses on the side: Helen sells fish and her husband works in a livestock business. Helen has been farming for 10 years and is currently growing millet, lentils, groundnuts, maize and mangoes on her land. She also tends to dairy goats, cows and poultry. 

This is Helen’s first loan and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to help pay her children’s school fees and to invest in new crops like sunflowers, which she says will help her bees and increase her income. Helen’s hope for the future is to grow her small business and receive training in business management, eventually reaching a level where she can become a trainer of trainers.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
Rómulo tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de productos de ferretería desde hace 5 años por lo que cuenta con clientela fija en la zona, su esposa e hijos le apoyan en las ventas, son una familia que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan.

Rómulo ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cemento y pintura para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Romulo is 45 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Morropin district, a community known for its carob forests, and where its population works as farmers, merchants, and raises livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.

He sells hardware items and has done so for five years.  He has steady customers in the area and his wife and children help with the sales.  They are a hardworking family.

Romulo is asking for a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy cement and paint to stock his business and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Geili

texts.es:
Geili tiene 20 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta chivos y aves de corral patos, gallinas, pollos, también ofrece servicios agrícolas en una empresa de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cabras y alimentos balanceados para engorde de aves de corral y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un buen precio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Geili is 20 years old and lives with his parents in the Cayalti district, a community where its people are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.  He raises and sells goats, ducks, and chickens.  He also provides farming services for a local company. 

He is asking for a loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles to buy goats and feed to fatten up his birds.  In this way he will be able to sell them at a good price and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy goats and feed.

loans.name: Amor De Dios Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMOR DE DIOS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Asunta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de coca, venta de material cristiano, venta de papa chuño y maíz, venta de productos nutricionales, venta de cosméticos, tienda de carnicería, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Asunta es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y maíz; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió conjuntamente sus padres, ya que el mismo es un negocio familia; a sus 15 años decide emprender su propio espacio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra papa y maíz) que adquirirá de las comunidades de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amor de Dios" (God's Love) will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Hub of Collpani. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, where Asunta is the president.

The business carried out by the members of the communal bank are varied; among them are: weaving blankets, selling coca leaf, selling Christian material, selling papa chuño (artisanal freeze-dried potato traditionally made in Peru) and corn, selling nutritional products, cosmetics sales, a butcher shop, and transportation services.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small business owners, one of whom is Asunta. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago, entering at the invitation of a promoter from the organization who came to visit her at her house.

Currently, she has a business selling potatoes and corn. She says that she learned this work alongside her parents, as it is a family business. When she was 15 years old, she decided to open her own location independently.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (purchase potatoes and corn) that she will obtain from communities in the city of La Paz; later, she will sell them in her sales stall. This type of work enables her to generate income to support her household as much as possible, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she enjoys the trainings on savings and health.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and corn.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1984 à Kadiana  commune de Kadiana, MOUSSA y  réside, (3ème Région administrative du Mali) avec sa femme et son 1 enfant dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Mr MOUSSA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des téléphones et accessoires en plus des panneaux solaires, des ventilateurs, etc. Il est très sollicité à Kadiana, et surtout le jour de foire. 
Fort de ses 3 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier  prêt individuel. 
MOUSSA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des téléphones et accessoires en plus des panneaux solaires et  des ventilateurs. Il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes de Bamako et  effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché.
MOUSSA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1984, Moussa lives in Kadiana in the 3rd administrative region of Mali, where he was born and raised, with his wife and one child in a traditional family. Moussa quickly became interested in income-generating activities, notably the purchase and resale of phones and accessories, as well as solar panels, fans, etc. He is well sought-after in Kadiana, especially on market days.

With three years of experience in this trade, Moussa is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso to increase his working capital so that he can better satisfy his growing customer base. This is his first individual loan. Moussa will use this loan to buy phones and accessories, solar panels and fans. He buys from wholesalers in Bamako and makes his sales in cash and sometimes on credit at the market. Moussa hopes to make a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA, which he will use to support his family, repay the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase telephones, telephone accessories, solar panels and fans

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 40-year-old married father of three children who has been working as a car's electrician for 25 years. He has wide experience in his domain since he was only 15 years old when he started working to support his parents. 

Hassan is a hard worker. Eleven years ago, he established his own business and he has developed it in a well-managed way. Today, Hassan is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a car for his business that he can use to provide mobile maintenance to customers upon request. The car will enable him to transport his tools and needs easily.

He also sells cars' electric spare parts, which provides him with additional income. He hopes that in the future, he can increase his business capital with car accessories.

loans.use: to buy a car to provide mobile maintenance to customers

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flow of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Sela is married and has six children. She engages in grain banking (storing grains in the harvest season to sell in the low seasons to make a profit) and cares for orphans. She is currently taking care of seven orphans. Her husband used to be a fisherman but now runs a grinding mill that turns maize and other grains into flour. Sela has been farming for 30 years and is currently growing maize, millet, lentils, beans, groundnuts and amaranth, as well as tending to cows and poultry. She likes beekeeping because it helps change the environment, as people are encouraged to plant trees on their plots. 

This is Sela’s first loan and she plans to use the income to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her beekeeping business to ten hives. She would like to thank Kiva lenders, “since we would not be able to buy the hives without them.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben lives and works outside of Sindo, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Reuben is married and has six children. He works as a primary teacher and his wife works on their farm and in their house. In his free time, he loves soccer and watching movies. He has been farming for 10 years and is currently growing maize, millet, sorghum, peas and beans. He also keeps a variety of livestock including cows, goats, sheep and poultry, and he cultivates natural forests on his land. He thinks that beekeeping is a beneficial project because it builds collaboration within the community and will help him to conserve the forest on his farm, thus “saving fauna and flora.” He is also intent on eating some of the honey that his hives produce. 

This is Reuben’s first loan and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to save for his children’s school fees and to set up a posho mill (a mill to grind maize into flour).

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives and works outside of Sindo town, in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flow of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Michael is married, and has 11 children. He works on his farm and runs a livestock business, while his wife cares for dairy goats and has a business selling samosas (small snack pastries stuffed with meat or lentils). He has been farming for 10 years and is currently growing maize, lentils, sorghum, beans and livestock on his land. He is also prepping an orchard for mangoes, avocados and citrus. Michael is excited to start beekeeping because the bees will help pollinate his orchard and provide his family with honey, which is a nutritious food. 

This is Michael’s first loan and he plans to use the income to help pay his children’s school fees and to continue to expand his orchard.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Prospero

texts.es:
Prospero tiene 41 años de edad vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques verdes y fertilidad de la tierra para los cultivos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente desde hace 10 años, actividad que consiste en procesar el jugo de la caña para luego purificarlo y obtener la bebida llamada llonque que es utilizada para fines festivos, curativos y antisépticos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un toro que le permitirá ahorrar en los costos que este invierte para la "molienda" es un método tradicional que se utiliza para extraer el jugo de la caña, consiste en unir a dos toros del mismo tamaño para dar vueltas a un equipo artesano donde se introduce la caña y se extare el jugo que luego se hierve para iniciar el proceso de destilación.
texts.en:
Propuesto is 41 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Callayuc district, a community known for its green forests and the fertility of its farmland.  It’s people work as farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Cutervo, within the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has been distilling whiskey for 10 years.  This consists of processing sugar cane juice for later purifying and obtaining the beverage called “llonque,” which is used for festivals and for medicinal and antiseptic purposes.

He is asking for a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles to buy a bull that will allow him to save on the cost of grinding, which is a traditional method of extracting the juice from the sugar cane.  Two equally sized bulls are used to turn the equipment, sugar cane is added, and the juice is then boiled to begin the distillation process.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 48 years old, married, and has one son. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income through running a motorcycle repair shop and they also sell tofu as a side business. 

They started this business ten years ago. Hong intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying tofu and motorcycle parts to sell for her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to gradually expand her business by buying tofu and motorcycle parts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants, Issa vit avec ses parents  dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Issa  n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études, raison pour laquelle il s’est basé sur les activités génératrices de revenus depuis plus de 5 ans. Il est très  sollicité par ses clients et pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, il fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso,  avec qui il est à son 1er prêt. Avec ce financement  il compte acheter  5 téléphones portables et accessoires à Bamako. Il effectue sa vente dans son kiosque Koutiala, à une clientèle mixte en espèce. Avec ce financement, il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Issa is a 35-year-old married father of four children. He lives with his parents in the city of Koutiala in the Sikasso region. Issa never had the opportunity to go to school and has been working on income-generating activities for the past five years. He is well sought-after by his customers and is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso to better satisfy his customers' needs. This will be his first loan.

With this loan, Issa will purchase five mobile phones and accessories in Bamako. He conducts his sales from his kiosk to a diverse customer base. Issa hopes to generate a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which he'll use to support the needs of his family and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en: Hovhannes is an experienced farmer from Mrgashat village in the Armavir region. He lives with his wife (in the photo) and his school-age son.  To take care of his family, Hovhannes is engaged in breeding piglets and in cultivating greens, melons, and watermelon. He realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family’s income. Hovhannes’ wife assists him greatly in his everyday activities related to farming. Hovhannes currently wants to expand his agribusiness to be able to more effectively cover the growing expenses of his family. To reach his goal, he needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase two steers, to buy some forage (alfalfa) for them, and to build a greenhouse. As this is Hovhannes’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Hovhannes and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase two steers and forage and to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman (pictured) is a 28-year-old married man who has been working in the transportation business since 2007. He has also been working in the agriculture business for twelve years.
Ayman is a hard worker who is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to start a new business for his wife (not pictured for personal reasons) to improve their family's living conditions and increase their income. Through the acquired YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, he will help her open a used clothes selling shop before the coming Christmas and winter season needs.
This is his first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower.  He hopes that in the future, he can work on developing his wife's business more widely.

loans.use: to start a used clothes selling business for his wife to improve their family's living conditions and increase their income.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
