Asha is a married woman. She describes herself to be courageous. She operates a food stall where she sells cooked food. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a competitive environment, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, her family will benefit from the business. She will plow back the profits into the business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 42, is married and has two children: one son and daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a coffee shop in front of their house. 

They started this business eight years ago. They sell coffee and soft drinks to people in their community. Huong is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular coffee and beverages, to stock her shop and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, coffee and beverages in particular, to stock her shop

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is 43 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is running a business of making and selling pork pies. Ngan earns income through running a general store. 

She started her business 13 years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a greater quantity of soft drinks, instant noodles and sugar to sell to her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of soft drinks, instant noodles and sugar to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Tuyet is a 36-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for four years. Tuyet would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionary, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income, help her to improve her family's living conditions, and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionary, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Sanh

texts.en:
Sanh is a 50-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a mason. For nine years, she has run a general store.

Sanh would like a loan to purchase a greater quantity of beverages, sugar and instant noodles to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of beverages, sugar and instant noodles to stock her store.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 41-year-old married woman. She has one son. Her husband is a worker for a local company. Thuy lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For five years she has operated a food stall to sell vermicelli with crab sour soup to people in her community.

Thuy would like a loan to purchase new furniture and good quality food for her business. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and good quality food for her stall

loans.name: Migina Tukorere Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Jadrece is a member of the Migina Tukorere Hamwe group and has previously borrowed twice from UGAFODE microfinance through the group. She is a married mother of two children. One of her children is seven and the other is four years old. She trades in bananas and she has been in business since 2000. She started the business with the hope of generating income to help her cater to the needs of her family. 

In addition to selling bananas, Jadrece also trades cattle which gives her more income. She works ten hours a day and feels the time is enough so that she is still able to rest and plan for her business. The business is located in Migina-Kagango in the Sheema district and her clients are mainly banana traders from the same location. 

Her main challenge in her business is high transport costs which reduce her profits. Her dreams for the future include buying a car which she will use for transport. She describes herself as an honest woman: an attribute she says has helped her to retain her customers. 

She applied for five hundred thousand shillings to buy cattle for trade so that her business can grow and increase her profits. In the long run she will use her profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to  buy cattle

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a young farmer from Khanjyan village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, two school-age sons, and her one-year-old daughter. To take care of her family’s needs, Emma is engaged in an agribusiness. With the help of her husband, she is involved in horticulture. They cultivate peaches, plums, and grapes, and realize the agricultural in the local market. The latter is the main source of the family’s income. To continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Emma needs to make some investments. A loan of USD 500 will be a huge support for this young hard working woman and her family and will enable her to purchase fertilizers and special medications for her trees, and to buy fuel for agricultural machinery. As this is Emma’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Emma and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and special medications for trees, and to buy fuel for agricultural machinery

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en:
Tinh, a 30-year-old father of three, lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn a living making and selling bag products, a business they began twelve years ago. 
Tinh requires a loan to purchase one more sewing machine and related equipment and accessories to produce and sell a larger quantity of bag products. He hopes that his business runs smoothly and enables him to improve his family's income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one more sewing machine and related equipment and accessories to produce and sell a larger quantity of bag products

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is requesting a new loan to pay her children's school fees and repair her old scooter for working transportation. That will help her to buy more kinds of products to sell at her store. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees and repair her scooter for working transportation

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang is requesting a new loan to buy more coffee, beverages, tea and to pay her children's school fees. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees and buy more tea, coffee and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, 51, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a food store in front of their house. 

She started this business seven years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a scooter that will help her to buy food and beverages in a greater quantity to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a scooter for working transportation.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is 39 years old, and is married with a son. Her husband supports his family by repairing clocks and watches. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She has been running a business of polishing nails and selling nail tool sets for 15 years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her child. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more nail polish and to upgrade her shop so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy nail polish and upgrade her shop.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 34-year-old single woman. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. For 13 years, she has run a business of selling dried fish to people in her community.

Dung would like a loan to purchase better quality dried fish in larger quantities. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her general store

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong would like to take a further loan to buy food to sell and to pay her children's school fees. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food to sell and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Mawatta

texts.en:
Mawatta lives in Sinkor. She is 38 years old and married with three children between 8 and 22 years old. Her husband is a businessman. For the past three years, she has been selling palm oil, coal, rice, etc., in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, coal, rice, etc., for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, coal, rice, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 28-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 9 years. She describes herself to be determined and hopeful. She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk for selling. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the drought season, which affects milk production. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy animal feeds. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that her future will be bright. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Vincente

texts.en: Vincente is 58 years old. She is married with five children. She sells bananas and has spent four years in the business. With the loan, she would like to add more bananas for resale, and the profits from the business will be used to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 52-year-old woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail store where she operates a maize grinding machine to produce maize flour for selling. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather conditions. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy stock of maize. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize

loans.name: Claver

texts.en: Claver is 33 years old. He is married with five children aged between 5 and 11; they all go to school. With the loan he has requested, he will add more items such as beers, sodas and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Osusu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tawopaneh Osusu” group. They are small-scale business people based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 3,100,000 Sierra Leonean Leones from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their individual businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 
The featured leader of this group is Ibrahim. Ibrahim is age thirty-nine. Ibrahim is married to a trader and the couple has five children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Ibrahim sells medicines. He has requested this loan in order to buy a wide variety of medicines to sell.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of medicines to sell

loans.name: Railway Line Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Railway Line” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each person in the group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 
Fatmata is the leader of this group. Fatmata is 31 years old; she is married with three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Fatmata sells cakes. With the help of this loan, Fatmata will invest in her business by buying flour, oil, ginger, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of cakes for sale.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, ginger, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of cakes for sale

loans.name: Futha United Group

texts.en: Aminata is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata is married to a businessman and the couple has three children, two of whom are still attending primary schools and one in secondary school. For many years now, Aminata has been selling cooked rice with delicious sauce. The 32-year-old has requested this loan in order to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, fish, tomatoes, onions and pepper in order to cook a large quantity of rice and sauce for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, fish, tomatoes, onions and pepper in order to cook a large quantity of rice and sauce for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 47-year-old mother of four children, who lives and does farming in Kitale. She has done farming for the past five years. She produces and sells milk, eggs, bananas and maize. She also has a retail business that acts as an extra source of income. She loves poultry farming but the major challenges are poultry diseases and very expensive poultry feed.

Grace chose Juhudi Kilimo because they have helped her to improve her life. This is the second loan that they have given her and it has helped her even to educate her children better and to improve her family's living standards. Grace appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for improving the lives of farmers.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 36-year-old married man. He has one child who is six years old. He describes himself as determined and confident. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as restrictions by local authorities. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to add stock of soap, sugar, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of soap, sugar, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Cay

texts.en: Cay would like to take a further loan to repair her family's scooter and to buy food to make crab noodles for selling. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her family's scooter and to buy food to make crab noodles.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong, 55, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two daughters, one son and her husband. Her husband is an instrumentalist. Phuong earns money through her business selling beverages. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of beverages and pay school fees for her children. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of beverages and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Kiwafu School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is William. He is the deputy head teacher of Kiwafu Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kitooro in Entebbe with 1,237 students. Kiwafu Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kiwafu Primary will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. William ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jerodin School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Juliet. She is the head teacher Jerodin Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kitooro in Entebbe with 350 students. Jerodin Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Jerodin Primary will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Juliet ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 33 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is single with one child, age 14. Her child is going to school and lives at home. Hawa did not go to school but she is a business-minded woman. Over the past four years she has been selling biscuits, candy, sardines and other items in the local market without facing any serious problems so far. She started this business by selling cola-nuts. She sells six days a week, spending 10 hours each day in her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits, candy, sardines and other items to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, candy, sardines and other items to increase her sales.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine, aged 31, is a mother of three children between four and eight. Only two of her children go to school. 

Alphonsine sells used shoes and has spent 2 years in this business. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes for resale. The profits will be used to reinvest in the same business for future growth.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Moving Star Group

texts.en:
Mahawa is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mahawa, age 35, is married and has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools.  Mahawa is a businesswoman who sells groundnuts/peanuts.
With the help of this loan, Mahawa and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.  Mahawa will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy bags of groundnuts/peanuts to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy bags of groundnuts/peanuts to add to her current stock

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en: Raymond is a 42-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 18 years. He describes himself as a confident person. He operates a farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge as low returns. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy a stock of tea leaves for resale and to pay school fees for his children. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a stock of tea leaves for resale and to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Pady-Pady Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Pady-Pady group. They are small scale business people based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone.

This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are borrowing from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) and Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their individual businesses, to earn more profit, and consequently, to improve their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Fatmata. Fatmata is 41 years old. She is married to a trader, and they have five children, four of whom are attending primary and secondary schools.

Fatmata sells groundnuts. She has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of groundnuts to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of groundnuts to add to her current stock

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Agé de 42 ans, Issa a une épouse est père de 4 enfants et domicilié  avec sa famille dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Mr Issa exerce les activités commerciales depuis plus de 10 ans. Sa boutique est située au centre commercial de la ville de Koutiala. 
Son activité lui procure assez de revenus vu sa demande qui est assez grande, car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité,  Issa a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 5ème prêt  individuel. Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition d’un grand stock de marchandises (articles en plastique : seaux, carafes, bassines, pots, bols). Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et auprès  des importateurs de Koutiala. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Issa compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA, qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aged 42, Issa has a wife and is the father of four children. He lives with his family in the city of Koutiala (region of Sikasso). Mr Issa has been carrying on commercial activities for over 10 years. His shop is located in the commercial center of the city of Koutiala.

His activity generates sufficient income given a quite large demand, as he receives many customers each day. For good customer satisfaction and to expand his business, Issa has called upon the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. This is his fifth individual loan.

This loan will be used to acquire a large stock of goods (plastic items: buckets, jugs, basins, pots, bowls). He gets his supplies from Bamako and from importers in Koutiala.

With the expansion of his business, Issa expects to make monthly profits of 90,000 CFA francs he will use to reimburse Soro loan interests, meet his family's needs and have the rest invested in his activity.

loans.use: buy plastic wares

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Mr YACOUBA est âgé de 52 ans, marié à une  épouse et père de  11 enfants. Il habite dans la ville de Koutiala  avec sa famille. 
YACOUBA n‘a eu la chance de faire des études raison pour laquelle il s’intéressa aux activités commerciales. Son activité est basée sur l’achat-vente de poissons fumés. Pour pouvoir augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décida de rejoindre  l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 4 ans. Il est à son 5ème prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été bien remboursés. Il compte acheter 15 paniers de poissons fumés  à Korientzé  (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs d’ethnie  Bozo et Somonô et effectue sa vente à Bamako en gros.  
Avec ce financement il compte  réaliser un profit de 100.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire les besoins  de sa  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr YACOUBA is 52 years old, married to one wife and the father of 11 children. He lives in the city of Koutiala with his family.

YACOUBA has not had the opportunity to study which is why he became interested in commercial activities. His activity focuses on buying and selling smoked fish.

To increase his stock supply and strengthen his sales capacity, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution four years ago. This is his fifth individual loan and all preceding loans have been fully repaid.

He intends to buy 15 baskets of smoked fish in Korientzé (Mopti region) from fishermen of the Bozo and Somonô ethnic groups, and resells wholesale in Bamako.

With this funding he expects to make monthly profits of 100,000 CFA francs he will use for Soro Yiriwaso interest payments, to satisfy the needs of his family and have the rest invested in his activity.

loans.use: buy smoked fish

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 44 year old married man. He has 2 children who are 2 years old and 6 years old. He describes himself as self reliant. 

Geoffrey operates a retail store where he sells sugar, rice, wheat flour, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are of all types. He also does tea farming to earn extra income.

His biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. He will use the loan of 20,000 KES to add stock of sugar, maize, wheat flour, rice, and other items. 

Geoffrey hopes that he will be financially stable in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, maize, wheat flour, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 44-year-old single woman. She has two children aged nine years and 20 years. She describes herself as a confident person. She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. 

She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a promising location, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low returns.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a stock of sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, and other ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous.  She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land. Previously, she was selling fruits and vegetables to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, and other ingredients

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a 27-year-old married man. He has two children aged six years and 10 years. He describes himself to be determined. 

Erick operates a retail business where he sells bags, cooking pans, and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of a permanent place for doing business. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to add a stock of bags, cooking pans, and other items. This is his first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will excel in business. He will use the anticipated profits to build a permanent place for doing business.

loans.use: to add a stock of bags, cooking pans, and other items

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He has owned a poultry shop since 2011 where he sells eggs, delicious and fresh meat. In parallel, he has worked independently, making tattoos and piercings since 2005. Ali works really hard in both jobs with the aim of earning a good income to be able to live in good conditions. And today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase more products of meat to increase his sales and let his customers enjoy his tasty goods. He is very optimistic and confident that the loan will allow him to gain more customers and higher revenue.

loans.use: to purchase products of meat.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 45-year-old widowed woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be confident.

She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are small scale customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low returns. 

Josephine will use the 20,000 KES loan to add a stock of tea leaves for resale. This is her second loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. 

Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to add a stock of tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Kepha

texts.en:
Kepha is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture for sale. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a busy and convenient place, and his primary customers are of all types. 

Kepha describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds to add stock. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to add a stock of timber, nails, and other materials for making furniture. This is his first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will succeed. Kepha will use the anticipated profits to take care of his family.

loans.use: to add a stock of timber, nails, and other materials for making furniture

loans.name: Las Viajeras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VIAJERAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras y coca, venta de repuestos de auto, venta de comida, venta de refrescos y gelatina por mayor, venta de frita, servicio de transporte, venta de verduras, costuras de busos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas que son socias en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás, ya que observó que este producto era muy comercial en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación en salud y crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal bank “Las Viajeras” will start their first loan cycle in ‘ProMujer’.  They belong to the Regional office of Senkata.  This group is made up of eight people and is managed by a board of directors of which Margarita is the President.  The businesses that the members of the communal association have are varied.  They include sales of, among others, vegetables and coca leaves, vehicle spare parts, food, soft drinks and jelly, fried snacks, transport services and sports clothes.

The loans they receive benefit the group of micro-entrepreneurs which Margarita is a member of.  She tells us that she has been a member of ‘ProMujer’ for two years, joining the association on invitation by her friends who are also members.  She currently has a business selling fruit.  She learnt this business several years ago, seeing how the product sold well on the market.

The loan she is asking for at the moment is to increase her capital (to buy fruit) which she will buy at the traditional food fairs in La Paz and afterwards she will prepare it and sell it on her stall.  This work helps her to generate an income which lets her support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about ‘ProMujer’, she replies that she likes the training sessions in the areas of health and credit which the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Karima

texts.ru: Карима молодая продавщица в возрасте 22 лет. Она на рынке своего города Конибодом имеет торговую точку, где занимается продажей женской, мужской и детской обуви. Карима занимается торговлей более 3 лет. Она замужем. Однако ее мужа сейчас нет рядом, он находится на заработках за пределами страны и Карима на данный момент живет у своих родителей. Одновременно Карима работает медсестрой в больнице, в отделении сердечных заболеваний. Она там работает по графику дежурств. Сейчас Карима нуждается в кредите для развития своего торгового бизнеса. На сумму от кредита она хочет приобрести ассортимент зимней обуви и тем самым увеличить количество продаж.
texts.en: Karima is a young, 22-year-old seller.  She has a retail outlet at a market in her town of Konibodom, where she is involved in selling women's, men's and children's shoes.  Karima has been involved in sales for over 3 years.  She is married.  However, her husband is not close by now; he is working outside the country, and Karima currently lives with her parents.  Concurrently, Karima works as a nurse at a hospital, at a cardiac diseases division.  She works there according to a shift schedule.  Now Karima needs a loan to develop her retail business.  She wants to use the loan to purchase a selection of winter shoes and, thus, increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase winter shoes and develop her business

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha is 22 years old. She owns a boutique from which she sells different items such as cooking oil and maize flour. She wants to buy more cooking oil and maize flour to sell with the loan that will be loaned by Kiva. The profits from her business will be used to expand her business, as well as to restock the products.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children, some of whom are still attending school. He has owned a small plot of land since 1995 where he cultivates different types of vegetables. He is a good farmer who always looks after his products to result in harvesting delectable goods. Today, with his loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will purchase a large quantity of potato seeds with the purpose of increasing his productivity, his sales and thus his income. Hasan has a lot of future plans and one of them is to open a vegetable shop where he will better display his products.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of potato seeds.

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Johana, tiene 30  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 9, 7 y 3 años de edad, los mayores estudian en  escuela. Su esposo chofer y comerciante.
Doña Johana es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para ella y para el esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, su esposo también utiliza parte del crédito para su negocio, el viaja fuera de la ciudad a comprar materiales necesarios para la pesca, que luego los vende a comerciantes de su ciudad o directamente a pescadores de la zona, tanto ella como su esposo trabajan todos los días el con sus transportes y venta de materiales de pesca y ella con la venta de ropa y zapatillas. Ella lleva más de tres años en esta actividad y su esposo muchos años más ya que es como han sacado adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, zapatillas  y materiales para la pesca. Está en el Grupo de Crédito más de 2 años y le gusta porque los créditos les permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un carro para realizar sus ventas
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Virgen Del Mar" (Our Lady of the Sea) meets every 15 days in the beautiful seaside community of San Mateo in the city of Manta.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year by both domestic and foreign tourists.  Most of the residents in this place are devoted to fishing or other jobs related to the sea.  

Sra. Johana lives in this place.  She is 30 years old, married, and has three children (ages 9, 7, and 3).  The older children are in school.  Her husband is a chauffeur and a merchant.  

Doña Johana is a good wife who will utilize this loan for herself and her husband.  She sells clothing of all types as well as slippers by going door-to-door.  Her husband will also use the loan for his business.  He will travel outside of the city in order to buy needed materials for fishing so that he can sell sell them to merchants in his area or directly to the local fishermen.  Johana and her husband work every day at their respective businesses of transporting people, selling fishing materials, and selling clothing and slippers.  She has been in business for more than three years while her husband has been working for many more years.  Both of them have been able to move their family forward.  

This loan will be used to buy clothing, slippers, and fishing materials.  Johana has been with the Communal Bank for more than two years and enjoys being a member because the loans have allowed her to get ahead.  Her dreams include having a car that she can use while making her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing and slippers, as well as fishing materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “16 DE JULIO” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por Nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de comida, elaboración ropa y comerciante de víveres, artesanía.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que hace once años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de artesanías; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años al contraer matrimonio y conjuntamente su esposo realizaban las decoraciones artesanales, posterior al fallecimiento de su esposo ella continuo con el negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tienda mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es viuda y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que desarrolla la institución.

En la fotografía esta presente un señor de negro, quien acompaña al grupo y a su esposa en el desembolso.
texts.en:
The communal bank ’16 de Julio’ are starting their eleventh cycle in ‘ProMujer’, belonging to the Regional Office Los Andes.  It is made up of nine members and has a board of directors of which Lucia is the President.  The businesses that its members have are varied.  They include food sales, clothes making, sales of provisions, and crafts.

The loans they receive help the micro-entrepreneurs, of which Lucia is a member.  She has been with’ ProMujer’ for 11 years.  She joined on invitation by her friends, who are also members.  Currently, she has a business making and selling crafts.  She tells us that she learnt this trade several years ago when she got married.  She used to make and decorate the crafts together with her husband, but since he died, she has carried on with the family business alone.

The loan she is asking for at the moment is to increase her capital (and buy cloth) which she will buy from wholesalers at El Alto city.  After preparing her goods, she will sell them at her stall.  This work helps her to generate an income to support her family, as she is a widow and has five children.

When she is asked what she likes about ‘ProMujer’, she says the training in health and credit which the institution offers.

In the photograph there is a man dressed in black, who is accompanying the group and his wife with payment.

loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Floricielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORICIELO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felipa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de awayos, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felipa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; cuenta que este negocio lo implementó después de hacer un amplio análisis del mercado, tanto de los productos, y los compradores.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra papa y arroz) que adquirirá de las comunidades de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘Floricielo’ is starting its first cycle with ‘Pro Mujer’, as part of the Regional Office of Collpani.  It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Felipa is the President.  The businesses that the members have are varied.  They include the sale of food, woven textiles and livestock.

The loans that they receive help the small micro-entrepreneurs, where Felipa is a member.  She tells us that it is her first time with ‘Pro Mujer’.  She joined after being invited by a representative who visited her house.  She has a business selling food, which she started after making an in-depth analysis of both the products and the customers on the market.

The loan is to increase her capital so she can buy rice and potatoes, which she will buy in the areas of La Paz and then sell on her stall.  This work allows her to generate an income to support her family as she is a single mother with four children.

When asked what she likes about ‘Pro Mujer’, she tells us that it is the insurance that they offer.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and rice

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association SABOUGNOUMA de DALABALA. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente  d’habillements, de cosmétiques et de céréales à l’image de BARO  qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DALABALA dans la  préfecture de YANFOLILA (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur septième  prêt solidaire. 
BARO, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  15 sacs de riz.  Elle s’approvisionne sr place auprès des producteurs  et vend ses produits à  TIELE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 18.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group belonging to the Sabougnouma association of Dalabala. It comprises five women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 25 years old, married with four children.

They conduct various activities such as buying and selling apparels, cosmetics and cereals like Baro, who is the first person standing from left to right in the photo.

They live in large traditional families in Dalabala, part of the Yanfolila prefecture (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali).
They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand for their activities.

In order to satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. They are on their seventh group loan.

Baro plans to use her loan to buy 15 bags of rice. She resupplies with local producers and retails her products in Tiele, for cash or on credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 18,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business activity

loans.use: buy rice

loans.name: Umedzhon

texts.ru: Умеджон начинающий предприниматель и в себе уверенный молодой человек. Он не женат. Ему 21 год. Умеджон хочет начать свою деятельность, открыть свой маленький магазин. Он уже арендовал помещение в центральном рынке города Турсунзода. Умеджон ранее пару месяцев работал в магазине своего друга продавцом, и теперь он решил начать собственный бизнес. Ему осталось купить необходимое количество дисков и журналов, и открыть магазин. У Умеджона на данную покупку нет необходимой суммы, поэтому он обратился за помощью. С надеждой на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Umedzhon is a beginner entrepreneur and a confident young man.  He is not married.  He is 21 years old.  Umedzhon wants to start his own business and open a small store.  He already leased a space at the central market of the city of Tursun-zoda.  Umedzhon previously worked as a salesperson at his friend's store and now decided to start his own business.  He has to buy the necessary discs and magazines and open the store.  Umedzhon does not have the sufficient amount of money for this purchase and this is why he requested help.  He hopes for Your support.

loans.use: to buy compact discs and magazines

loans.name: Brenda Lorena

texts.es:
Brenda Lorena, convive con el padre con el cual ha vivido toda la vida, él trabaja en  construcción y solo gana menos de trecientos mil pesos, por el momento no se encuentra laborando y lleva más de 1 mes sin trabajo, ella no cuenta con el apoyo de la mama  por lo tanto él se hace cargo de los gastos del hogar, como son el arriendo, alimentación, servicios públicos, educación, también se hace cargo de los hermanos de ella e hijos de el con el cual no conviven pero también tiene que darles del gasto diario.
Brenda estudio en el colegio distrital donde comenzó su primaria y termino su bachillerato en limpio sin perder ningún año, por tal motivo el padre se siente orgulloso y sintió darle a la hija un buen futuro pero no tuvo para que pudiera estudiar en una buena universidad, pero paso 6 meses sin estudiar, hasta que encontró el aviso de CAMPO ALTO  donde inmediatamente llamo y al darle los nombres de los cursos que brindaban el que más le llamo la atención fue AUXILIAR EN ENFERMERÍA , ella vio que al fin iba poder estudiar una carrera  que le gusta que iba a ayudar a las demás personas sin esperar nada a cambio y que si en  algún momento le pasara algo a la familia ella con el conocimiento adquirido podría ayudarle. 
En este tiempo que ha pasado se encuentra contenta por lo que ha aprendido hoy en día y porque sabe que hay grandes cosas para el futuro y para que algún día pueda tener un mejor bienestar y ser una gran persona y una profesional en la carrera que hoy en día está ejerciendo.
texts.en:
Brenda Lorena resides with her father with whom she has lived her entire life.  He works in construction and only earns less than 300,000 COP.  At the moment, he is not working and has been unemployed for more than a month.  Brenda does not receive support from her mother, so her father is responsible for household expenses such as rent, food, public services, and education.  He is also responsible for Brenda's other siblings, as well as his children who do not live them but also have daily expenses that he must cover.  

Brenda attended a district school where she started at the elementary level and eventually finished her high school diploma without skipping a year.  For this reason, her father is very proud of her and wants to give his daughter a good future but he was not able to send her to a good university.  Therefore, Brenda was not in school for six months until she saw an advertisement for CampoAlto.  She immediately called and was given the names of the courses that were offered.  The ones that caught her attention were related to the Nursing Assistant Program.  She could see herself in the end studying for a degree in which she could enjoy helping other people without expecting anything in return.  If there were some point in which something happened in her family, then she will have gained knowledge that would be helpful.  

Since that time, Brenda is pleased with what she has learned to date because she knows there are great things in store for her in the future.  Someday she will enjoy greater well-being and become a successful person.  She will also be a professional with a degree that she can put to use.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
FOTEMOGOBAN est un groupe de l’association SIGUIDIA de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de cosmétiques, de condiments et  d’habillements à l’image de DJOUMA  qui est la seule personne assise de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe  décident d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
DJOUMA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  N’TENTOU, excelle dans la vente d’habillements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  20 pagnes wax.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Fotomogoban group is part of the Siguidia association of N'Tentou. It comprises four women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 30 years old, married with five children.

They conduct various activities such as buying and selling cosmetics, condiments and apparels like Djouma, who is the only person kneeling in the photo. They live in large traditional families in N'Tentou, part of the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand for their activities. In order to satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program where they secured their first group loan.

Djouma , who is the president of the group and very well known in N'Tentou, excels in selling apparels. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 pagnes wax (a type of colorful West-African fabric).

She resupplies in Bamako and with local wholesalers, and retails her products in Ouelessebougou, for cash or on credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 15,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business activity.

loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es:
Leonides es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Leonides tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene un hijo; el cual ya no depende de ella económicamente. Vive en casa rentada desde hace 8 años y se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo.

Su negocio es la venta por catálogo de artículos varios como perfumes, cosméticos, zapatos, colchas y ropa en general. Pide este préstamo para comprar mercancía, en específico cosméticos, ropa y calzado; productos los cuales sus clientes le piden más.

El negocio de Leonides le ha permitido cubrir todas sus necesidades, por ellos es que lo cuida mucho y le gusta tratar con sus clientes. Su principal reto es continuar con su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Leonides is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

She is 55 years old, married, and has no financial dependents.  She has been living in a rental house for eight years and earns her living by selling products through catalogs.  The various items she sells include perfumes, cosmetics, shoes, bedspreads, and clothing in general.  Leonides is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise, specifically cosmetics, clothing, and shoes.  These products are what her customers request the most.  

Her business allows her to cover all of her needs.  For this reason, she takes great care of her business and enjoys attending to her customers.  Her main challenge is continuing her business so that she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé exclusivement de femmes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 54 ans 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Korokabougou commune de Wacoro préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de céréales, de gâteau, d’habits, de chaussures,  et de tubercules. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente SIRANTOU la 1ème personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout est commerçante d’articles divers. Elle s’approvisionne à Tonga en chaussures, de boucles d’oreille, de chaines, d’habits pour enfants. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 8000 FCFA qui sera ajouté au fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed exclusively of married women, who average 54 years of age and three children each. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Korokabougou, Commune de Wacoro, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They have restaurants and do commerce in condiments, grains, cakes, clothing, shoes, and tubers. The women of the group BENKADI are on their first solidarity loan . 

This client, SIRANTOU, who is the first person standing at the left, is a merchant of a variety of goods. She gets her supplies of shoes, earrings, necklaces, and children's clothing in Tonga. She plans on making a monthly profit of 8,000 francs CFA that will be added to her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase various goods to sell

loans.name: María De La Cruz

texts.es:
María de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado de educación media,  en la actualidad esta acompañada desde hace ocho años su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura, el hijo único de 5 años de edad empezara a estudiar este año, además ellos viven en la misma casa de los padres de su esposo.  


María se dedica a realizar oficios domésticos  como profesión, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura y un poco a la ganadería y también ella ayuda a realizar este trabajo.

El  préstamo que esta  solicitado a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar un torete para rejero de las vacas y mejorar la producción de ganado y leche, para satisfacer la necesidad de su familia obteniendo más recursos  económicos.

En el futuro,  propone que en un corto plazo tendrá su casa porque en este momento viven con sus suegros y es necesaria la privacidad y que así como vive no toma las decisiones solo la pareja, sino que también los suegros su gran sueño es tener su casa.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old and studied as far as 9th grade of middle education. She currently has a partner who she has been with for 8 years. Her partner works in agriculture and their only son, who is 5, will start school this year. They live in the same house as her husband's parents. María earns a living doing domestic work while her partner works in agriculture and some of the time in livestock. She also helps with this work.

The loan she is asking for from CREDICAMPO is to buy a young bull for inseminating the cows to improve the production of animals and milk. This will meet the family's needs by providing a better income. In the future, her short term plans are to have her own house because at the moment they are living with her in-laws. They need privacy and also living in this way means the couple cannot make decisions on their own but have to involve the in-laws. Her main dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a young bull as a breeding stud.

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en: Hannington is a 42 year old married man. He has 5 children ranging in age from 13 to 23. He describes himself as determined and confident. He operates a boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) business, transporting customers from one place to another. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be restrictions by local authorities. Hannington will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to excel within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will succeed. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to build a home.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 42-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself as honest. He is a mason, and he builds houses to earn a living. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy tools for building houses. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a mason's trowel, joint filler and other tools for building houses. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will succeed. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy a mason's trowel, joint filler and other tools for building houses

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 28-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as stable. Esther operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy more stock. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add to her stock of shoes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of shoes

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 25-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife in a small simple house in the city. For the past two years, Wael has been working in a small shop for selling clothes. It is a good project and earns him a good income. Wael would like to improve his business and maybe in the future open a bigger store. 

Wael took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more clothes for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Wael's sales will increase, as will his income.

Wael appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for his store to resell.

loans.name: Dickens

texts.en: Dickens is a 42-year-old married man. He has four children ranging in age from 12 to 20. Dickens describes himself as determined. He operates a photography business where he takes photos. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of a permanent place for doing business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy camera film and other photography materials. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future he will succeed. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy camera film and other photography materials

loans.name: Hernan Felipe

texts.es:
Su nombre es Hernan felipe tiene 16 años y la pasión de el siempre ha sido el estudio, desde que era pequeño se inclino mas hacia el lado humanitario, de ayudar a aquel individuo que pueda, que nunca lo halla visto que no lo conozca a el ni a su familia, pero que sabe que tiene un dolor, que necesita una mano amiga un apoyo ya sea físico o mental, por eso deside estudiar auxiliar de enfermería.
Con ayuda de los padres, la familia y campo alto cumple este propósito, actualmente cursa tercer semestre y esta realizando sus practicas y no pensó que algo tan simple como el "Gracias" de un niño a quien se le asistió la comida o aquella sonrisa de un adulto mayor a quien se le presta la ayuda llenaría tanto y valiera mas que cualquier cantidad de dinero.
Campo alto me enseño el valor el valor humano que tiene cada que es inigualable a cualquier fortuna, le enseño todo tipo de de valores mas lo que ya le habían enseñado en el hogar, le enseño que el respeto y la paciencia es la mayor virtud y aun sigue aprendiendo cosas grandes y nuevas de esta institución.
texts.en:
This is Hernan Felipe, aged 16, who has always had a passion for studying. Since he was little he has always had a leaning towards the humanitarian area, for helping anyone he could, even if he had never seen them before and he and his family did not know them, but simply because he knew they were in pain or needed a helping hand and support, whether it be physical or mental. 

This is why he decided to study to be a nursing auxiliary. With the help of his parents, family and Campoalto he is fulfilling this goal. He is currently in his third semester of studies and is doing his practicals. He never thought that something as simple as a "thank you" from a child he has helped with their food or the smile of an elderly person he has helped would bring so much satisfaction and be worth more than any amount of money. 

Campoalto has taught him the human value of each individual which cannot be matched by any fortune. They have taught him all sorts of values on top of what he had already been taught at home. They have taught him that respect and patience are important virtues and he is still learning new and important things at this institution.

loans.use: to pay the registration fees for a semester.

loans.name: La Vérité Group

texts.fr: La cliente Joséphine est une commerçante, présidente et membre d’un groupe d’affaires « La Vérité », senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 53 ans et mère de 10 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse de friperie depuis 10 ans. Elle installe ses marchandises sur la rue dans une avenue animée de la place. Elle sollicita un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Son conjoint est un technicien de construction(Maçon). Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de la tontine. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment critique poste conflit dans la région de l’Est du Pays.
texts.en:
Joséphine is a trader and the president of the business group 'La Vérité' (The Truth).  She is fifty-three years old and has ten children who all attend school.  Her husband is a building mason.

Joséphine is a very dynamic entrepreneur and has a lot of experience in her business, having sold second-hand clothing for ten years.  She sells her clothing from a position on a busy local road.

Joséphine has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business.  She will buy a parcel of second-hand clothing with her loan.  Joséphine started her business with funds received from a savings group (tontine).

In the future, Joséphine would like to increase her working capital, and feed, clothe and educate her children.

She is grateful to Hekima for the support they provide to women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system, this is particularly valuable now, following the conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy a parcel of second-hand clothes for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tesoritos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TESORITOS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Isis es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa, servicio de albañil, comerciante de muebles, venta de papa, chuño y tunta, venta de choripanes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Isis es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de choripanes (pan con embutidos de cerdo); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y ya que en los mercados de la ciudad de El Alto no existe tanta competencia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “TESORITOS” communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Panamericana center. It is made up of ten members and is led by Isis, who is the treasurer. The members' businesses are varied. Among them are: selling food, selling clothes, bricklaying, selling furniture, selling potatoes, selling chuño and tunta (dried potatoes), and selling choripanes (sausage sandwich).

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Isis. She says that this is the first time that she has been a member of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution, Right now, she has a business selling choripanes (bread with pork sausage). She says that she learned this business on her own initiative because in the markets of the city of El Alto there isn't very much competition. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying vegetables wholesale. She will acquire them from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later she will sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family. She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, She says that she likes the health information offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Tosheka Group

texts.fr: Madame nakabe âgée de 48ans ;est membre du groupe tosheka. Mariée a un homme d affaire, est mère de 9 enfants tous scolarisés.elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 135 paniers domestique artisanaux.Elle espère un jour agrandir son entreprise, avoir une maison et un magasin a partir de crédit qu’elle reçoit de Hekima.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nakabe, age 48, is a member of Tosheka Group. She's married to a business man and the mother of nine children, who all go to school.

She's seeking this loan to buy 135 artisanal baskets. She hopes one day to expand her business and own a house and a shop, with the help of the loans she receives from Kiva's partner, Hekima.

loans.use: to buy 135 artisanal baskets

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kistaabsida Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZENABO  est responsable du groupe KISTAABSIDA.  Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 35 ans et le moins âgé a 20 ans.  Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge. 
Mme fait la restauration  et commerce général  depuis 30ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Boussé et à Sabtenga  villages environnants. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes et enfants.
 Elle veut s’acheter 04sacs de poids de terre pour la restauration. 
Elle épargne ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité de restauration et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Zenabo is the representative for the Kistaabsida Group.  She is married and has four children between the ages of twenty and thirty-five years.  Her children do not attend school, and she is financially responsible for three people.  

Zenabo has run a restaurant and general trade business for thirty years.  She buys her supplies in Boussé and the villages around Sabtenga.  Her customers are men, women and children.  She will buy four sacks of bambara peas for her restaurant business, with her loan.  The earnings that she makes will be used to strengthen her business.

In the future, Zenabo would like to expand her restaurant business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of bambara peas for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLITAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de cordones, servicio de albañil, artículos varios, venta de zapatillas deportivas, tejido de chompas, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatillas deportivas; cuenta que este lo implementaron sus padres y ella ayudaba en el negocio familiar, posteriormente decide implementar su propio espacio de comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zapatillas deportivas) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Communal Bank “Estrellitas” [Little Stars] is starting its second cycle with Pro Mujer, in the regional office of Collpani. It is composed of eight members and led by a board where Sandra is the president. The members perform different activities, such as clothing sales, shoestrings sales, masonry, retail, shoes sales, weaving and fruit sales.

The loan they are requesting will be useful for micro entrepreneurs such as Sandra. She says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for six months now and that she started when one of the institution’s promoters visited her at home and invited her to join. She runs a business selling sport shoes. She says it was her parents who started it and she helped them, but then she decided to become independent.

The loan she is requesting will help her to increase her working capital and buy sport shoes from wholesalers at La Paz. She will afterwards sell them at her establishment. With this business, she makes enough to sustain her family, since she is single and has a son.

She says that what she likes the most about Pro Mujer is the training opportunities they offer.

loans.use: to buy sport shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rosario Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSARIO”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amanda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, venta de queso, tejido de mantas, venta de comida, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amanda es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa.
